0.title: Kyiv urges global ban on Russia's RT after anchor's call to drown Ukrainian children
0.article_body: Ukraine has urged a global ban on the Russian channel RT after one of the channel's news anchors allegedly said that Ukrainian children who saw Russians as occupiers under Soviet Union should have been drowned. Ukraine has termed the channel an 'incitor of genocide'. RT's Editor-In-Chief Margarita Simonyan said she had suspended the presenter, Anton Krasovsky, for his "disgusting" comments.

1.title: Plane overshoots runway at airport in Philippines, nobody injured
1.article_body: A Korean Air passenger plane overshot the runway at the Mactan-Cebu International Airport in the Philippines late on Sunday, the airline informed. The 162 passengers and 11 crew members on board the aircraft escaped using emergency slides. The airport was closed in the aftermath of the incident as the aircraft remained stuck at the end of its lone usable runway.

2.title: Cheteshwar Pujara re-signs with Sussex for 2023 County season
2.article_body: Sussex have retained the services of India batter Cheteshwar Pujara for the 2023 season. "I am glad to be back with Sussex for the 2023 season. I thoroughly enjoyed my stint with the club last season," said Pujara. Last year, the batter scored over 1000 County Championship runs, including a record-breaking three double centuries, at an average of 109.4.

3.title: Cristiano Ronaldo only keen on joining a European club: Report
3.article_body: Journalist Fabrizio Romano said Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo is still keen to join a European club despite reports linking him to other leagues. "Ronaldo's priority has always been to continue in Europe. I'm sure his agent will explore the market in the next 1-2 months," said Romano. Ronaldo's contract with Manchester United expires at the end of the season.

4.title: B'luru residents form human chain to protest against potholes in city
4.article_body: Residents in Bengaluru have been complaining to the civic authorities regarding the pothole menace in the city. In a recent incident, residents of the city, including children and the elderly, formed a human chain on Sunday demanding an immediate solution to the potholed roads. According to the residents, they approached the civic authorities several times in the last six months.

5.title: Umpire made the right decision: Taufel on India's byes after Kohli got bowled on free hit
5.article_body: Former Australian umpire Simon Taufel stated that the umpire made the right decision in giving India three byes and not signalling a dead ball after Virat Kohli got out on free hit in last over against Pakistan. "For a free hit, the striker cannot be out bowled and therefore the ball is NOT dead on hitting the stumps," he stated.

6.title: SC revokes Gauhati HC order granting bail to accused arrested with morphine
6.article_body: The Supreme Court revoked a Gauhati High Court order granting bail to two men accused of possessing morphine. The accused were released on bail after being in jail for about a year. ''In our considered view, in the face of the mandate of Section 37 of the [NDPS] Act, the High Court...[shouldn't have granted] bail," the apex court said.

7.title: Two loud blasts heard in Syrian capital Damascus
7.article_body: Two blasts were heard across Syria's capital Damascus on Monday, and state media said they could have been caused by an Israeli strike. Israel has been carrying out strikes for years against what it calls Iranian and Iran-backed targets in Syria, where Tehran has stationed forces to support Syrian President Bashar al-Assad since the onset of the Syrian Civil War.

8.title: Rishi Sunak to become first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent
8.article_body: Rishi Sunak has won the race to be leader of the Conservative Party and will become UK's next Prime Minister. His only rival, Penny Mordaunt, conceded and withdrew on Monday. Sunak will become the first UK PM of Indian descent. Earlier, Liz Truss resigned from the post after 45 days in office amid massive economic crisis.

9.title: Girl dies after molestation attempt, Meerut Police probe university staff
9.article_body: The Meerut Police said that they are probing the role of the staff of a private university after a 19-year-old jumped off the fourth floor, following an alleged molestation attempt. The police said that the university did not inform them about the incident. According to the FIR, she was being pestered by another student, who allegedly molested her.

10.title: VCs of 9 universities can continue in their posts until Guv's final order: Kerala HC
10.article_body: The Kerala HC on Monday held that Vice-Chancellors of nine universities can continue in their positions until the Governor issues a final order following a show-cause notice that was issued on Monday. Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday issued notices to the VCs to show cause by November 3 on their legal right to continue in office.

11.title: 31-yr-old Pune man assaults police officer, tears his uniform; held
11.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a traffic police officer and tearing his uniform at Karachi Chowk in Pimpri. The incident took place on Saturday when the accused approached the officer for stopping the traffic flow from one direction and allegedly abused him. He then held the officer by his collar and tore his uniform.

12.title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari seen with TMC leaders in Birbhum
12.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari was seen with two TMC councillors of Suri municipality at Bamni Kali Temple in West Bengal's Birbhum district. Calling the meeting a "coincidence", the TMC councillors Ujjwal Chatterjee and Kundan Dey said it was "without any political significance". Dey added, "We don't take politics to the temple. TMC has always been courteous to Opposition leaders."

13.title: Alpine F1 protest against Alonso being stripped of US GP points
13.article_body: Alpine F1 have protested against Haas's appeal about the safety of Fernando Alonso's car being upheld, leading to the driver losing his seventh place at the US Grand Prix. Haas had objected post-race to Alonso and Red Bull's Sergio Perez being allowed to continue racing with loose bodywork. Alpine said Haas lodged their protest 24 minutes past the specified deadline.

14.title: Tottenham lacks squad depth to challenge for PL and CL: Manager Conte
14.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said his squad lacks depth to challenge for both the Premier League and Champions League titles. "My only worry at this moment is...that we don't have (more) injuries...this (lack of depth) is not something against the club, we knew this situation," said Conte. Tottenham remains third in the Premier League, five points behind leaders Arsenal.

15.title: Will gherao Odisha CM Patnaik's residence on Oct 31: State BJP
15.article_body: The BJP has threatened to gherao Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik's residence if action is not taken in the Archana Nag blackmailing case and the killing of a BJD Zilla Parishad member. BJP said the CM's residence will be gheraoed on October 31 if the Odisha Police failed to take action in 48 hours. They have also threatened a state-wide agitation.

16.title: Leopard attacks, kills 18-month-old girl in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
16.article_body: A leopard attacked and killed an 18-month-old girl in the forested area of Mumbai's Aarey Colony on Monday. The incident happened when the child followed her mother, who was on her way to a temple about 30 feet away from her house. The girl was injured by the leopard and was declared dead after she was taken to a hospital.

17.title: 2 people killed in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn in Mexico
17.article_body: Two people lost their lives on Sunday in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn after it made landfall along Mexico's Pacific coast, authorities said. Roslyn made landfall as a Category 3 hurricane in the Mexican state of Nayarit at 5:20 am (local time), the US National Hurricane Center informed. The hurricane later weakened into a tropical storm while moving inland.

18.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by mistake: Kenyan police
18.article_body: The killing of 50-year-old senior Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif in Nairobi was a case of "mistaken identity", Kenyan police said. Sharif was shot and killed by police after the car he was in sped up instead of halting at a roadblock near Nairobi, police said. The police were searching for a similar car involved in a case of child abduction.

19.title: Punjab records nearly 3,700 stubble burning cases over 5 weeks
19.article_body: Punjab recorded 3,696 stubble burning incidents between September 15 and October 22 with 60% being logged in the three districts of Tarn Taran, Amritsar and Gurdaspur. Tarn Taran reported 1,034 stubble burning incidents, followed by Amritsar at 895 and Gurdaspur at 324. "Paddy harvest is complete in 35% of the total cultivated area in Punjab," said an agriculture department official.

20.title: K’taka Minister gives gold, ₹1 lakh as Diwali gift to elected representatives
20.article_body: Karnataka Tourism Minister Anand Singh's Diwali gifts to elected municipal and panchayat members in the Hospet constituency has sparked a row. The picture of the box, which contained ₹1 lakh cash, 144 gm of gold, 1 kg of silver, a silk saree, a dhoti and a dry fruit box, went viral on social media.

21.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by police in Kenya
21.article_body: Arshad Sharif, a senior Pakistani journalist, was shot dead in Kenya when police hunting car thieves opened fire on the vehicle he was travelling in as it drove through their roadblock without stopping, according to Kenyan police. The incident took place at 10 pm on Sunday evening on the outskirts of Nairobi. Sharif's death has sparked widespread outrage in Pakistan.

22.title: 3% of Mumbai's women have hypertension, 2% have diabetes: BMC
22.article_body: A health campaign carried out by the BMC found that 3% of Mumbai's 18-plus woman population has hypertension while 2% has diabetes. In Mumbai, 2,13,177 women were screened for hypertension, while 2,05,345 were screened for diabetes. The 'Mata Surakshit Toh Ghar Surakshit' drive was to end on October 31 but has been extended to mid-November.

23.title: Snake found under bed at Telangana's MGM Hospital; video surfaces
23.article_body: A snake was found under a patient's bed in a ward of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial (MGM) Hospital in Telangana's Warangal. A video of the incident showed the snake slithering under the bed in the second such incident reported from the hospital in less than two weeks. A patient's attendant had, on October 13, found a cobra inside MGM Hospital's washroom.

24.title: Aliens do walk among us: Wasim Akram on Virat Kohli after India's win over Pakistan
24.article_body: After Virat Kohli helped India defeat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Aliens do walk among us, he's one of the best I've seen in the recent or modern greats." Akram added, "He has been scoring for the last 15 years, and he has the best average while chasing."

25.title: Kohli praises Ashwin for leaving ball in last over, says 'Dimag ke upar extra dimag lagaya'
25.article_body: Virat Kohli praised Ravichandran Ashwin for leaving a delivery bowled by Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz in last over, which went on to be a wide. He said, "I told Ashwin to hit...ball over covers. But Ash...usne dimaag ke upar extra dimag lagaya. That was a brave thing for him to do...Ball came inside the line and he turned it into wide."

26.title: Inspection done at Pune Railway Station, additional staff deployed
26.article_body: After a Bihar labourer lost his life due to heavy crowds at the Pune Railway station, a detailed inspection was carried by the Pune Railway Division and the Railway Protection Force (RPF) police.  The Pune Railway Division also deployed additional manpower of RPF policemen and other railway staff at all platforms. They reviewed security arrangements and the crowd was monitored.

27.title: We are prepared to tackle incidents on Diwali: Delhi Fire Service
27.article_body: Even though it is illegal to burst firecrackers in the national capital, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) has made all the arrangements to handle fire occurrences on Diwali. "We are prepared with drones and to access high-rise buildings. Fire tenders have been deployed near congested areas. However, we expect there will not be many fire-related incidents," chief of DFS said.

28.title: Coimbatore cylinder blast definite act of terror by fidayeen: Report
28.article_body: The cylinder blast in Coimbatore is a definite act of terror by fidayeen, reports said. Jamesha Mubin, who was killed in the cylinder blast on Sunday, had written "if the news about my death reaches you, forgive my mistakes, hide my shortcomings, participate in 'Janaasa' and pray for me" on the display of his mobile phone, reports added.

29.title: Hasan Minhaj points out his resemblance to Suryakumar in graphic shared by ICC
29.article_body: Comedian Hasan Minhaj took to Twitter to point out his resemblance to Suryakumar Yadav in a  graphic of the Indian cricketer shared by the ICC. Reacting to the cricketer's graphic, the comedian tweeted, "Pls tag me next time ICC." Several Twitter users agreed that the two resembled each other, with a user tweeting, "Separated at birth?"

30.title: Protestors throw chocolate cake on King Charles III's wax statue in UK
30.article_body: Two supporters of 'Just Stop Oil' attacked a Madame Tussauds waxwork model of King Charles III with chocolate cake in London. The protestors demanded that the UK government halts all new oil and gas licences and consent. "The science is clear. The demand is simple: just stop new oil and gas. It's a piece of cake," the protestors said.

31.title: Fitbit sued in Australia over refund policy on faulty devices
31.article_body: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) began court proceedings against Fitbit for misleading consumers about faulty devices. Fitbit has come under fire for claiming that consumers won't get refunded unless they return faulty products within 45 days of purchase, which is against Australian Consumer Law. The ACCC said that 58 consumers were allegedly misled by Fitbit.

32.title: We've been lot more nicer in this season: Bani on 'Four...' co-stars
32.article_body: Speaking about the bond between 'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars, actress Bani J has said they have been a lot "nicer" in the third season. "(We have been) a lot more of understanding," she added. "Somebody said tolerance the other day, but it's not tolerance. It's more of an understanding like...'let her be'. That kind of an understanding," Bani stated.

33.title: BJP leader Rapolu Bhaskar quits party, set to join ruling TRS
33.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, BJP leader Rapolu Ananda Bhaskar resigned from the party and is set to join the ruling TRS on Monday. He expressed disappointment over the Centre’s decision to levy GST on handlooms and said that he appreciated CM KCR’s measures to enhance the condition of weavers in the state.

34.title: PWD proposes ₹12 crore budget to govt for Mumbai’s JJ Hospital renovation
34.article_body: The Maharashtra State Human Rights Commission (MSHRC) has directed the PWD to start repairs in Mumbai's JJ Hospital immediately. The PWD, according to a junior officer, has submitted a report to the government with a proposed budget of ₹12.66 crore. MSHRC said they have been receiving complaints about the hospital's infrastructure from resident doctors for a "long time".

35.title: People started taking me seriously after 'Four More...': Maanvi Gagroo
35.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has said that people started taking her seriously after her series 'Four More Shots Please!'. "Till 'Four More Shots Please!' happened I was getting roles that were girl-next-door," she stated. Maanvi added that the show also helped with her social media following. "The kind of offers I'm getting now are interesting...Thankfully...I can pick and choose," she said.

36.title: Kerala HC’s special hearing on VCs’ petition against Governor order
36.article_body: The Vice-Chancellors of nine universities of Kerala, who were asked to resign by the Governor's Office, have approached the Kerala High Court. The High Court will hold a special sitting at 4 pm on Monday to consider the petition. "I have received the decision...but I will not submit my resignation...This is a fake accusation," said Kannur University VC Gopinath Ravindar.

37.title: Ugandan capital's Ebola tally reaches 14 with 9 new confirmed cases
37.article_body: Nine more people tested positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala on Sunday, the Ugandan Health Ministry said on Monday, taking the city's number of confirmed cases reported since Saturday to 14. All the patients who have tested positive were in isolation when they became symptomatic, the ministry said. The current Ebola outbreak in Uganda began in September.

38.title: French court approves €238 million Credit Suisse settlement
38.article_body: A French court approved a €238 million (₹19.37 lakh crore) settlement between Credit Suisse Group and the French financial prosecution office to settle a tax fraud and money laundering case. Under the terms of the agreement, the Swiss bank makes no admission of guilt. The settlement will see the bank pay a fine of €123 million to the state.

39.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
39.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

40.title: Opp'n claims Tripura minister’s son involved in 16-yr-old’s gangrape
40.article_body: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in Tripura's Unakoti district. The opposition Congress and CPI(M) have claimed that a state minister's son was involved in the incident and called for his arrest. The girl was allegedly gang-raped in a three-storey building in Kumarghat on October 19.

41.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
41.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

42.title: Starlink won't be turned off even without funding: Musk to Ukrainian Vice PM
42.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Monday reassured Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov that his firm SpaceX "would not turn off Starlink even if [US Department of Defence] refused to provide funding". Musk was replying to media reports claiming some European Union countries may fund Starlink services in Ukraine. "Thanks Musk...This was critically important for Ukraine. We're grateful to you!" Fedorov said.

43.title: 4 pose as policemen & rob Mumbai beautician of cash, valuables worth ₹7 lakh
43.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday arrested three people, including a woman, who allegedly posed as police officers and barged into a beautician's house, robbing her of cash and valuables worth over ₹7 lakh. The police, during the interrogation, learned that the victim's family friend had informed the accused about the valuables, following which a plan was hatched, a police officer said.

44.title: US, UK warn of possible terror attack in Nigeria's capital Abuja
44.article_body: The US and Britain on Sunday warned their citizens in Nigeria about a possible terror attack in the country's capital, Abuja, aimed at government buildings and tourist attractions, among other targets. Nigeria has been battling an Islamist insurgency since 2009, primarily in the northeast. In July, however, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for a major prison raid in Abuja.

45.title: Mumbai gang clones debit cards, withdraws ₹6.47 lakh in 58 transactions
45.article_body: A gang in Mumbai withdrew ₹6.47 lakh through 58 transactions in three days. Using cloned debit cards, the gang withdrew ₹500 on October 4, ₹4.9 lakh in 49 transactions on October 5 and ₹70,000 in seven transactions on October 6 from an ATM in Marol. They also withdrew ₹87,000 in two transactions from an ATM in Chakala on October 5-6.

46.title: India break world record for winning most matches in int'l cricket in a calendar year
46.article_body: The last-ball four-wicket victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday was India's 39th victory in international cricket in 2022. With this, India broke the world record for winning the most number of matches in international cricket in a calendar year. The previous record was held by Australia, who had won 38 matches in 2003.

47.title: Fans will watch film that appeals to them: Akshay on Ram Setu-Thank God clash
47.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about the clash between his film 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Thank God', has said that there is no clash. "Fans will choose to watch the one that appeals to them the most or better...watch both," he stated. Akshay added, "The main objective is for...fans to enjoy the festival at the movies with friends and family."

48.title: Delhi man dies after his parked SUV catches fire in Alipur
48.article_body: A man was burnt alive after his parked SUV caught fire in Delhi's Alipur area on Sunday. The victim has not yet been identified as only his bones remained after the fire. "The car is registered in the name of a person who lives in Kurukshetra [in Haryana]. A police team has been sent...for further inquiry," police said.

49.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF: Chapter 1', becomes 2nd highest-grossing Kannada film
49.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has earned around ₹188 crore worldwide since its release, making it the second highest-grossing Kannada film. The film went past Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 1'. However, 'KGF: Chapter 2' is still the highest-grossing Kannada film. In India, Kantara has earned ₹170.50 crore, with the film earning ₹111.25 crore in Karnataka.

50.title: Celebrate Diwali with deprived people, UP CM tells officers & employees
50.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath extended Diwali greetings on Monday and urged officers and employees to celebrate the festival with the deprived and needy people. In a tweet, CM Adityanath said that it should be our endeavour to illuminate every house with the spirit of harmony, adding that there should be 'Ramatv' all around.

51.title: North Korea and South Korea exchange warning shots near sea border
51.article_body: North and South Korea exchanged warning shots off the western coast of the Korean Peninsula on Monday. Seoul said its forces fired warning shots to repel a North Korean merchant vessel that had breached the Northern Limit Line (NLL), the de facto sea boundary between the two countries. Meanwhile, Pyongyang accused a South Korean naval ship of violating the NLL.

52.title: OTTs, social media platforms may pay access charge to telcos: Report
52.article_body: Social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook and Twitter, along with over-the-top (OTT) firms like Netflix, Prime Video and Disney+Hotstar, may reportedly have to pay carriage charge to telecom operators. As data grows, telecom service providers have to keep increasing their carriage capacity and backhaul networks, which requires investment. The draft Telecom Bill may adopt this regulation.

53.title: That's why they won the match: Babar on journalist's 'Kohli was the difference' remark
53.article_body: During the press conference following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, a journalist, while asking a question, remarked Virat Kohli was the difference between the two sides. Pakistan captain Babar Azam interrupted the journalist and said, "That's why they won the match." He further said that Kohli's 53-ball 82* knock will give the India batter "more confidence".

54.title: WWE's Heyman shares Kohli's pic, jokes 'He acknowledged our tribal chief Reigns'
54.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman shared a picture of Virat Kohli from celebrations following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. He jokingly wrote, "It's with great honor that I, #SpecialCounsel and #Wiseman to #Bloodline, accept the great @imVkohli's celebration as, in front of the world, he decided to acknowledge our tribal chief @WWERomanReigns."

55.title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passes away
55.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passed away on Monday. He was the former Vice Chairman of Biocon. John, a member of Biocon's board of directors since 1999, was a foreign promoter and on the advisory board of various Biocon group companies, according to the company's website.

56.title: Delhi was most polluted city in the world, not anymore: Kejriwal
56.article_body: After Delhi was not featured on the list of the top 10 most polluted cities of Asia, CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "Some years back, [Delhi] was the most polluted city in the world. Not anymore!" Lauding the people of the city, he added "While we have improved, there is still a long way to go".

57.title: India will always seek to strengthen UN's effectiveness: S Jaishankar
57.article_body: On the 77th anniversary of the United Nations, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar claimed that India will always seek to strengthen the UN's effectiveness. "India’s ongoing tenure as a member of the Security Council has reflected our principled approach of promoting dialogue and diplomacy to meet contemporary challenges. We will always stand with the Global South," tweeted Jaishankar.

58.title: After 'Tanhaji', I was offered to play Shivaji Maharaj many times: Sharad
58.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar revealed he was offered the role of Shivaji Maharaj many times after his portrayal of the character in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Tanhaji'.  "I responded by asking 'How many films will I do with the same character?' And they said that they feel I would do justice to the character," he added. Sharad will feature in 'Har Har Mahadev'.

59.title: Multiple subways in B'luru continue to remain submerged despite no rains
59.article_body: Multiple subways in Bengaluru continued to remain filled with water despite the city witnessing no rains in the past few days. Commuters complained that many pedestrian subways, including the Nrupathunga Road and Raj Bhavan Road subways, were inaccessible due to the water. "It has been over three days. There is no action from the authorities," a resident said.

60.title: China's GDP grows by 3.9% Y-o-Y in July-September quarter
60.article_body: The GDP of China showed a 3.9% year-on-year growth in the July-September quarter, amid a raft of government measure. However, domestic demand declined towards the end of the quarter due to persistent COVID-19 restrictions, a prolonged property slump and global recession risks. In the nine months to September, China's inflation-adjusted urban per capita consumption fell 0.2% on year.

61.title: World's largest diya lit up in Punjab's Mohali; pic surfaces
61.article_body: The world's largest diya was lit up in Punjab's Mohali amid Diwali festivities. More than 10,000 people contributed 3,560 litres of oil for an event to light up the diya made with 1,000 kilograms of steel. The diya, which was recognised as the world's largest by the Guinness World Records, measures 3.37 metres in diameter.

62.title: 258 people arrested in Chhattisgarh for luring people into online betting
62.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police has arrested 258 people in 25 cases over the past month for operating centres to lure people into online betting via online application 'Mahadev'. The application was launched by group of people operating out of Dubai. "They opened around 30 centres, mostly in Chhattisgarh, and over ₹200 crores of transactions happen from each of these centres," police said.

63.title: Mumbai Police turn 'bhajiwala', 'doodhwala' to crack 30-yr-old assault case
63.article_body: Mumbai Police cracked a 30-year-old assault case and arrested a 57-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a woman in 1993. Police posed as milkmen, vegetable vendors, courier boys and postmen to nab the accused, who was taken into custody on October 20. The accused had attacked the victim with a chopper and was on the Mumbai Police's most wanted list.

64.title: 2 bodies found after plane carrying Gold's Gym owner crashed off Costa Rica
64.article_body: Two dead bodies were recovered by Costa Rican authorities on Sunday during their search for people who were on board a small plane that crashed in the Caribbean Sea on Friday. Rainer Schaller, the owner of fitness chains Gold's Gym and McFit, and five others were listed as being on the aircraft. The recovered bodies could not be identified immediately.

65.title: Jindal Group to enter lending business with ₹400 crore investment
65.article_body: Gaurav Sachdeva, the Chief Executive Officer of JSW One Platforms (JSWOP), said the JSW group will enter the lending space with an investment of up to ₹400 crore in a non-bank finance company (NBFC). The NBFC will be a subsidiary of JSWOP. Sachdeva said the NBFC can help other JSW companies like cement, steel, or paints by offering financing solutions.

66.title: Russian oil supplies to China in Sept rise 22% YoY, second to Saudi
66.article_body: Russian oil supplies to China in September 2022 rose 22% YoY while Saudi Arabia remained the top oil supplier to China. Russian supplies in September totalled 7.46 million tonnes, equivalent to 1.82 million barrels per day (bpd), data from Chinese General Administration of Customs showed. This is down from the record high of nearly 2 million bpd imported in May.

67.title: Notice asks women lawyers to not 'arrange hair in open court' in Pune; pic shared
67.article_body: Senior Supreme Court advocate Indira Jaising has shared a picture of a Pune court notice that asked women advocates to refrain from arranging their hair. "It's repeatedly noticed that women advocates are arranging their hair in open Court, which is disturbing the functioning of the Court," it read. "Wow now look! Who's distracted by women advocates and why," Jaising wrote.

68.title: Major fire breaks out at drugs manufacturing unit in Chennai
68.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private drugs manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Monday. The fire department received the information about the fire at around 8.15 am and several fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire engulfed the entire building and several vehicles parked near the firm were also charred.

69.title: Taskin records his career-best T20I figures as B'desh defeat Netherlands
69.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Netherlands by nine runs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Monday. Batting first, Bangladesh posted a total of 144/8, with Afif Hossain (38 off 27) being the top-scorer for the side. Netherlands were eventually bowled out for 135 runs as Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed registered his career-best T20I figures of 4-0-25-4 in the match.

70.title: People asked me, 'Hero kaun hai?' I replied 'me': Janhvi Kapoor on 'Mili'
70.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said whenever she tells people she's working on a female-oriented film, they address it "like it's an anomaly". She asked if they'd ask an actor their feeling about doing a male-oriented film if her upcoming film 'Mili' was called 'Milan'. "Many times, when I'm doing this film, I'm asked, 'Hero kaun hai?'...I answer 'Me'," she stated.

71.title: Power connection of Bhagat Singh's house never disconnected: Administration
71.article_body: The district administration of Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar, Punjab, rejected reports that the power connection of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral house was disconnected. "In fact, Powercom has an advance bill payment worth ₹6,760 with them," Deputy Commissioner Navjot Singh said. He also made an appeal to the media not to use the name of Bhagat Singh's ancestral house.

72.title: At least 220 killed in tribal clashes in southern Sudan
72.article_body: At least 220 people were killed in two days of tribal fighting as of Saturday night in Sudan's southern Blue Nile province, a senior health official said on Sunday. The clashes erupted in the town of Wad el-Mahi due to a land dispute between two tribes. A 30-day state of emergency has been declared in the Blue Nile province.

73.title: Why was Karthik given out despite Rizwan collecting ball in front of wickets?
73.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was stumped out by Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan on the bowling of Muhammad Nawaz in the last over despite Rizwan collecting the ball in front of wickets. The ball wasn't called a no-ball as the ball had hit Karthik's pads before reaching Rizwan. As per MCC's Law 27.3.1, Rizwan's collection of the ball was legitimate.

74.title: Delhi LG VK Saxena, CM Arvind Kejriwal wish people on Diwali
74.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished happiness and prosperity to the people of the national capital on Diwali. The LG also urged everyone to follow precautionary measures for COVID-19 and pollution while celebrating the festival. Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter and said, "May goddess Laxmi always reside in your house."

75.title: Woman steals gold worth ₹12 lakh from 54-yr-old cousin in Mumbai
75.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹12 lakh from her 54-year-old cousin's house in Mumbai. The accused first visited her cousin on September 24. She again visited on September 30 and used her cousin's bedroom to change clothes. The complainant noticed the absence of her ornaments on October 9, resulting in her filing a complaint.

76.title: I broke up with Julia as I was scared she'd leave me: 'Friends' star Matthew
76.article_body: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry in his forthcoming memoir revealed that he dated actress Julia Roberts for a few months. "Dating Julia Roberts had been too much for me. I'd been constantly certain that she was going to break up with me," he wrote. "So instead of facing the inevitable agony of losing her, I broke up with her," he added.

77.title: 'We all lost as a team', says Babar Azam to Pak cricket team; PCB shares video
77.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam addressed the Pakistan cricket team after it was defeated by India in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne on Sunday. In a video shared by Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Azam told the team, "We all lost as a team. Nobody should point fingers at one person, this shouldn't happen, not in this team," he added.

78.title: PM participates in 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with jawans in Kargil on Diwali
78.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who is in Kargil celebrating Diwali with Army Jawans, took part in a 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with members of the Armed Forces. PM Modi can be seen clapping and humming the song in a video, while several jawans can be seen playing musical instruments. PM landed in Kargil on Monday to celebrate Diwali with jawans.

79.title: Brazilian President's ally throws grenades at police to evade arrest, 2 officers injured
79.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's ally Roberto Jefferson threw grenades at police officers who arrived at his residence in Rio de Janeiro to arrest him on Sunday. Two police officers were injured and taken to a hospital. A Supreme Court judge earlier ordered his detention for insulting Chief Justice Carmen Lucia. President Bolsonaro condemned the armed attack.

80.title: DRI seizes narcotics worth ₹15 cr from Mumbai airport cargo; 3 held
80.article_body: Officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested three persons, including a Nigerian national and seized narcotics worth ₹15 crore from the Mumbai international airport cargo. The officials recovered 1.9 kg of Amphetamine Type Substance (ATS) as tablets, which were packed in polythene packs concealed inside the body of the corrugated packaging material, an official said.

81.title: 28-yr-old punched, hit with belt by 3 for 'staring' at 1 of them in Mumbai
81.article_body: A 28-year-old man was allegedly killed by three persons following a dispute over staring at one of them in Mumbai, a police official said on Monday. The official said that the accused allegedly hit the victim on his head with a belt, punched him and also hurled abuses. The incident took place on Sunday.

82.title: College students wear 'anti-cheating' hats, masks during exams in Philippines; pics viral
82.article_body: Pictures of college students wearing 'anti-cheating' hats and masks in the Philippines have gone viral on social media. A professor of mechanical engineering at Bicol University College of Engineering shared the pictures and wrote, "Midterm Exam Moments." The students created homemade hats and masks out of cardboard, egg boxes and other recycled materials.

83.title: Met John Abraham as courier boy, it was life-defining: Harshvardhan Rane
83.article_body: Actor Harshvardhan Rane revealed he met John Abraham as a courier boy to deliver the latter a Yamaha helmet. "It was a life-defining moment...he made me comfortable. He invited me to the event for which he had flown to Delhi. He...gave me his mobile number," he added. Harshvardhan said he still doesn't have the "guts" to call John.

84.title: Dravid sir told me to be calm, I said 'Sir, I'm just happy to be here': Hardik
84.article_body: In a conversation with Virat Kohli after their win against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup, Hardik Pandya revealed that coach Rahul Dravid, when he was coming in to bat, told him to "just be calm". Hardik added, "So, I just had to tell him that, 'Sir, please understand I am just happy to be here'."

85.title: Massive fire breaks out at a house in Itanagar, causes damage worth lakhs
85.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a house in Naharlagun, a town in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar district, resulting in "damage worth lakhs". "The fire completely burnt 15 rooms of the rented kutcha house unit...along with...important documents," said the house's owner Mena. There have been no casualties reported so far. There's no information available over the reason behind this incident.

86.title: ICC shares video of fans chanting 'Chak De India' in stadium after India beats Pak
86.article_body: ICC took to social media to share a video that showed fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground chanting 'Chak De India' after India beat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match. The video also showed the fans whistling and cheering for Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53). "Raw vision: Behind the scenes of India's sensational win," ICC captioned the video.

87.title: 34-year-old man dies of cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan match in Assam
87.article_body: A 34-year-old man identified as Bitu Gogoi passed away after suffering cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Assam's Sivasagar district. Bitu was watching the match at a local cinema hall with his friends when he suddenly became unconscious and fell down. He was rushed to a local hospital, where the doctors declared him brought dead.

88.title: Philips announces 4,000 job cuts, CEO says 'difficult, but necessary decision'
88.article_body: Dutch medical equipment maker Philips announced 4,000 job cuts following a massive recall of respiratory machines that slashed around 70% off its market value in the past year. Philips CEO Roy Jakobs called the decision "difficult, but necessary". "My immediate priority is to improve execution so that we can start rebuilding the trust of patients, consumers and customers," he added.

89.title: HC quashes case against boy who accidentally crashed cycle into old woman
89.article_body: The Bombay High Court quashed a case that had been filed against a 10-year-old boy, who had accidentally caused injuries to a 62-year-old woman by crashing into her while cycling. It also ordered the state government to provide compensation of ₹25,000 to the boy and his mother. The  amount will be recovered from the police officers involved in the case.

90.title: Akshay's 'Ram Setu' is convergence of science, history, Ramayana: Director
90.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma said Akshay Kumar's 'Ram Setu' is a convergence of science, history, geography and Ramayana. As per the film's producer Vikram Malhotra, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi "played an important part in bridging the areas of history and spirituality with his extensive research over decades". Dr Dwivedi, who directed Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj', was brought in as a creative producer.

91.title: 4-year-old shot dead in Agra, father's friend held
91.article_body: A four-year-old boy was kidnapped and later shot dead allegedly by his father's friend in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. According to reports, the accused tried to mislead the family of the victim by helping in search for the boy and recovering the body. The weapon used has been recovered but the motive is yet to be ascertained, said police.

92.title: Sudarsan Pattnaik sculpts Goddess Kali's sand art with 4,045 diyas
92.article_body: Renowned sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a 5-foot-high sand art of Goddess Kali by using 4,045 diyas with the message, "Let us burn out all the negativity," at the Puri beach in Odisha. "This Diwali, I want to appeal to people to keep our environment clean and pollution free," said Pattnaik.

93.title: Cong criticises K'taka govt for spending ₹4.5 crore on a promotional video
93.article_body: The Karnataka Congress criticised the state government for spending around ₹4.5 crore on a 5-minute video to promote the upcoming Global Investors Meet (GIM) in Bengaluru. Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said that the government, which has failed to provide jobs, is spending an exorbitant amount on promotion. The Global Investors Meet is scheduled from November 2 to November 4.

94.title: 25-yr-old journalist dies after falling into under-construction stormwater drain in Chennai
94.article_body: A 25-year-old journalist working with a private news channel in Tamil Nadu's Chennai died after falling into an under-construction stormwater drain while returning home from work. He apparently tried to leap over the trench. He was taken to VH hospital and later shifted to Government Royapettah Hospital, where he succumbed to the injuries.

95.title: Rohit Sharma mimics journalist during presser after win vs Pakistan, video goes viral
95.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma mimicked a journalist during the press conference following last-ball win against Pakistan. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen answering in the journalist's accent. "I felt really good, I felt really good," Rohit said while mimicking. People present at the press conference were then heard laughing.

96.title: Video of Melbourne Cricket Ground echoing with Indian National Anthem goes viral
96.article_body: A video has gone viral showing thousands of Indian fans singing the National Anthem ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The official Twitter handle of the Mumbai Police shared a video taken by a fan, writing, "The country and anthem we all rise up for." More than 90,000 spectators attended the match.

97.title: Governor seeking VCs' resignations is undemocratic: Kerala CM Vijayan
97.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has termed state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan seeking resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state as "undemocratic". Vijayan added, "Governor's post is not to move against the government, but to uphold constitution's dignity. He's acting as a tool of RSS." Governor Arif had directed VCs to send him resignations by 11.30 am on Monday.

98.title: Apple CEO shares Diwali pic clicked by Mumbai photographer, calls it 'beautiful'
98.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Monday shared a picture clicked by Mumbai-based photographer Apeksha Maker. "This photo beautifully captures why Diwali is known as the Festival of Lights. Wishing all who celebrate a holiday full of joy and prosperity," he tweeted. The photographer said she was "humbled" to see Cook share the image.

99.title: 5 family members killed as car rams into truck in UP's Basti
99.article_body: Five members of a family were killed after their car rammed into a container truck in UP's Basti district on Sunday. The victims include a 60-year-old man called Sanjeev Kumar, a 40-year-old woman named Ankita, his 17-year-old son and 14-year-old daughter. Another 40-year-old woman died in the accident. The family was travelling to UP's Sant Kabir Nagar district from Lucknow.

100.title: Prabhas fans cause fire at theatre after bursting firecrackers on his b'day
100.article_body: A fire broke out at Venkatramana theatre in Andhra Pradesh after fans of actor Prabhas burst firecrackers during the screening of the 2009 film 'Billa' on the occasion of the actor's birthday. The seats in the theatre caught fire, however, it was put out by theatre employees and movie watchers. No casualties were reported from the incident.

101.title: Minor boy tied to pole & beaten up on suspicion of theft in UP; video surfaces
101.article_body: Three men tied a minor boy to a pole and thrashed him on the suspicion of theft in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district. A video of the incident shows one of the men tying the boy's hands and legs. The Azamgarh Police said it has arrested all three accused, who are aged 32, 45, and 52 years.

102.title: Can't have better Diwali than being with you: PM to soldiers in Kargil
102.article_body: PM Narendra Modi reached Jammu and Kashmir's Kargil to celebrate Diwali with jawans on Monday. "I cannot have a better Diwali than being with you," he said, adding that Diwali means "festival of end of terror" and Kargil has made it possible. "A country is actually proud when its soldiers' heads are as high as the Himalayas," PM Modi added.

103.title: Cyclone 'Sitrang' to intensify into severe cyclonic storm by tonight
103.article_body: Cyclone 'Sitrang' is very likely to intensify into a severe cyclonic storm in next 12 hours and continue its movement, the India Meteorological Department said on Monday. It is likely to cross Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip early Tuesday. North coastal Odisha is expected to receive heavy rainfall, while heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over Bengal.

104.title: It was redemption for him in one way: Jaffer on Arshdeep's 3/32 vs Pak
104.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised India pacer Arshdeep Singh for registering figures of 3/32 against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup match. "It was redemption for him (Arshdeep) in one way," said Jaffer. Arshdeep had faced online abuse for dropping Asif Ali's catch in India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 match last month.

105.title: 26,000 people visit Byculla Zoo over Diwali weekend, generates ₹10L
105.article_body: A revenue of ₹10 lakh was generated after 26,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the Diwali weekend. "Almost 18,000 visitors were recorded on Sunday," said the zoo director Dr Sanjay Tripathi. The zoo has undergone a revamp over the last few years with new exotic animals brought from different places to enhance the experience.

106.title: 25-yr-old Mumbai businessman jailed after pulling 16-yr-old's hair, calling her 'item'
106.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai businessman has been sentenced to 1.5 years in jail for harassing a 16-year-old school student. The man in 2015 had pulled the girl's hair and told her, "Kya item, kidhar ja rahi ho?" The POCSO court ruled that the word "item" to address a girl is used in the context of objectifying her sexually and nothing else.

107.title: ICC shares video of Ashwin hitting match-winning run, Dravid's reaction goes viral
107.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India's Ravichandran Ashwin hitting the match-winning run against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022. The video shows reactions of Indian players and support staff from the dugout. Team India head coach Rahul Dravid's animated reaction has gone viral. "If Rahul Dravid is celebrating...it means it's really special," a fan commented on Instagram.

108.title: Google CEO Pichai celebrates India's win over Pak, responds to troll on Twitter
108.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai on Monday tweeted, "Happy Diwali!...I celebrated by watching the last three overs again today, what a game and performance #Diwali #TeamIndia #T20WC2022." When a troll tweeted, "You should watch 1st three overs," Pichai responded by tweeting, "Did that too...what a spell from Bhuvi and Arshdeep." India beat Pakistan by 4 wickets on Sunday.

109.title: BCCI shares video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after Pakistan match
109.article_body: The BCCI has shared a video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. In the video, Pandya can be heard telling Kohli, "I would have taken a bullet for you, but I wouldn't have let you get out." Kohli and Pandya shared a 113-run stand for the fifth wicket.

110.title: Russian fighter jet crashes into house in Russia as both pilots 'suffocate in cockpit'
110.article_body: A Su-30 Russian warplane crashed into a house in Russia on Sunday, killing two people. The casualties were believed to be the pilots as earlier reports suggest they had suffocated in the cockpit during the test flight. The plane fell nose-first into a suburb of Irkutsk city. Three children were said to have been evacuated from the building.

111.title: Invite from The White House has come as true surprise: Karsh Kale
111.article_body: Indian-American music composer Karsh Kale has reacted to being invited to The White House for Diwali celebrations. "After three challenging years of the pandemic, this invite has come as a true surprise," he stated. This is the second time Karsh has been invited to The White House. He was first invited in 2013 under the tenure of ex-President Barack Obama.

112.title: Virat Kohli, the name is enough: Wahab Riaz on Kohli's innings vs Pakistan
112.article_body: Pakistan pacer Wahab Riaz said the India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup on Sunday was "intense" and the "better team won". Riaz also praised Virat Kohli for his match-winning innings, tweeting, "Kohli, naam hi kaaafii haa, (Kohli, the name is enough)." Former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez also praised Kohli, tweeting, "It was special innings from a very special player."

113.title: To my B'wood friends: Kangana on 'If I hurt you, you deserve it' meme
113.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kangana Ranaut shared a meme, which read, "To anybody, I hurt this year, you deserve it." Along with the meme, the actress wrote, "Now that the year is ending, I want to confess something similar to my Bollywood friends." Kangana, who recently starred in 'Dhaakad', will feature in 'Emergency'.

114.title: 20 wagons of coal-laden goods train derail in Maharashtra; multiple trains cancelled
114.article_body: As many as 20 wagons of a coal-laden goods train derailed in Maharashtra's Amravati district late Sunday night. There was no report of any casualty in the incident that took place between Malkhed and Timtala stations. After the derailment, several passenger trains have been cancelled or diverted, railway officials said on Monday.

115.title: India reports 1,334 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,193
115.article_body: India reported 1,334 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,994 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,193. The data showed that 1,557 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,977.

116.title: Two people arrested for sale of illegal firecrackers in Noida
116.article_body: In two separate raids, Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested two people for storage and sale of illegal firecrackers. Huge quantity of firecrackers was seized from both the suspects. Cases have been registered against them under various Sections of the Explosives Act. "Police will take strict action if any offenders are caught," said Gautam Buddha Nagar's District Magistrate.

117.title: I'll not do it: Kannur University VC on Kerala Governor seeking resignation
117.article_body: After Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan sought resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state, Kannur University Vice-Chancellor Dr Gopinath Ravindran, who's among the nine VCs, said he'll not resign. "A VC's resignation is based on financial irregularities and bad behaviour, neither of which has happened," he said. Kerala Education Minister has criticised Governor's move.

118.title: Delhi Police arrest 29 people for gambling, seize ₹58 lakh
118.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 29 people, including 7 women, for gambling at a hotel in the Punjabi Bagh area on Sunday. They also recovered over ₹58 lakh and 10 sets of playing cards. "On October 22, specific inputs were received that a large number of people were assembling at the hotel for...gambling at the banquet hall," said DCP Ghanshyam Bansal.

119.title: Saw a tear in Virat's eyes, this was unforgettable: Harsha Bhogle on India's win over Pak
119.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's match-winning knock of 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I've seen Virat for so many years. I've never seen a tear in his eyes. I saw it today. This was unforgettable." Kohli broke down after helping India beat Pakistan. India scored 16 runs in last over to win the match.

120.title: What records did Virat Kohli break in match against Pakistan?
120.article_body: With his 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, Virat Kohli became the leading run-scorer in T20I cricket with 3,794 runs. With 24 fifty-plus scores, Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for recording most 50-plus scores in ICC events. Kohli also broke the record for winning most Player of the Match (POTM) awards in T20Is, with 14 awards.

121.title: Govt releases pic of PM Modi in Kargil to celebrate Diwali
121.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Kargil to celebrate Diwali. The Prime Minister's Office released a picture of PM Modi in the region and tweeted, "Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has landed in Kargil, where he will celebrate Diwali with our brave soldiers." PM Modi has been celebrating Diwali with Indian Army soldiers since 2014.

122.title: 11-yr-old activist's phone snatched while shooting live video; Noida Police responds
122.article_body: Environmental activist Licypriya Kangujam's phone was snatched in Greater Noida's Sector 16B on Sunday while she was going live on Facebook, the 11-year-old tweeted. Responding to her tweet, DCP Central Noida said, "Police station in-charge Bisrakh has been directed to take necessary action...FIR has been registered at police station Bisrakh, necessary legal action is being taken in advance."

123.title: Begin your revolutionary 5G journey with Airtel 5G Plus: Airtel
123.article_body: Airtel announced that its 5G Plus services will be available in 8 cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and more in a phased manner. The brand has been at the forefront of 5G innovation, offering 30 times higher speed with super-fast call connect, it said, adding that the Airtel 4G SIMs offers 5G services on all 5G smartphones.

124.title: Want to come back here again: Ram Charan on RRR's response in Japan
124.article_body: Actor Ram Charan, who has been in Japan promoting his film 'RRR', has said that he wants to come back to the country again. "I can see so many emotions in this room, which is making me emotional. This is so heartwarming...appreciative. I can never forget this moment," he added. 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli was also present in the auditorium.

125.title: Rohit Sharma shares pics from India-Pakistan match, says 'Great night at the G'
125.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match, which took place at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday. "Great night at the G," he captioned his post. Commenting on his post, a fan wrote, "Your and Virat's hug was the moment of the match."

126.title: Many think there's cold war between Rohit, Virat but it's not like that: Jaffer
126.article_body: Talking about the viral pic of India captain Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli after their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "It was a good moment." Jaffer added, "Many fans think there's some cold war going on between Rohit and Virat but it's nothing like that." Kohli scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan.

127.title: 'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working: Saeed Ajmal after Pakistan's loss to India
127.article_body: Taking an apparent dig at Pakistan captain Babar Azam following their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal tweeted, "'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working." The term 'Ghabrana nahi hai' has been known to have been used by Babar to encourage his players. Pakistan lost the match on the last ball.

128.title: Delhi's air quality moves towards 'very poor' category on Diwali morning
128.article_body: The air quality in Delhi on Diwali morning moved towards 'very poor' category amid a drop in temperature and wind speed. The Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 298 at 6 am on Monday. Forecasting agency SAFAR earlier predicted that the air quality may plunge to 'severe' levels on the night of Diwali if people burst firecrackers like last year.

129.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson pulls out of Prime Ministerial race
129.article_body: Ex-UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced his decision to pull out of the race to replace Liz Truss as the nation's Prime Minister. "There's a very good chance that I'd be successful in the election...But in the course of the last [few] days, I've sadly come to the conclusion that this would...not be the right thing to do," added Johnson.

130.title: PM Modi, President Murmu wish people on Diwali
130.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu greeted people on the occasion of Diwali on Monday. "Diwali is associated with brightness and radiance. May this auspicious festival further the spirit of joy and well-being in our lives," PM Modi said. "On this great festival, I pray for happiness and prosperity in the lives of all Indians," President Murmu tweeted.

131.title: Rahul Dravid hugs Virat Kohli after his match-winning knock vs Pakistan, pic goes viral
131.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid hugged Virat Kohli after the latter scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. A picture of the same has gone viral on social media. "Two legends in one frame," a fan commented on the picture. "Very emotional," wrote another.

132.title: Warning issued to 8 states as cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' approaches
132.article_body: As the deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang', the IMD has issued red and orange alerts for eight states. 'Red alert' has been issued for Tripura, Assam, Mizoram, Manipur and Nagaland while 'orange alert' has been issued for Arunachal Pradesh and West Bengal. The cyclone will reach West Bengal-Bangladesh coast on Tuesday.

133.title: Pune Police use mild force as people block traffic after India's win over Pak
133.article_body: Pune Police used mild lathicharge to control the unruly crowd that gathered to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. "Many of them started bursting firecrackers. The crowd then came onto the road and blocked the traffic. The firecrackers were being burst in a dangerous manner," police said. Police also extinguished a large garland firecracker with water.

134.title: Bengaluru to witness partial solar eclipse for 45 minutes tomorrow
134.article_body: Residents of Bengaluru will be able to witness a partial solar eclipse for around 45 minutes on October 25. Beginning at 5:15 pm on Tuesday, the eclipse will last till sunset at about 6:00 pm and will be at its maximum at around 5:49 pm. Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium officials have asked residents to avoid watching the eclipse with naked eyes.

135.title: Activists throw mashed potatoes at $110 mn Monet painting in Germany, release video
135.article_body: A video has shown climate activists throwing mashed potatoes at a Monet painting at a German art gallery, weeks after activists doused a Van Gogh artwork with tomato soup in the UK. Two activists from Letzte Generation (Last Generation) vandalised French painter Claude Monet's Haystacks, which sold for $110 million (around ₹907 crore) in 2019, to protest a climate catastrophe.

136.title: Verstappen beats Hamilton to win US Grand Prix, Red Bull takes constructors' title
136.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen won the United States Grand Prix on Sunday, while his Red Bull team secured the Formula One constructors' world championship a day after the death of their billionaire owner Dietrich Mateschitz. Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton finished second in the race, followed by Charles Leclerc (Ferrari), Sergio Perez (Red Bull Racing) and George Russell (Mercedes).

137.title: Unbelievable game, India vs Pakistan is always more than a game, it's an emotion: Yuvraj
137.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Yuvraj Singh called India's match against Pakistan at T20 World Cup 2022 an "unbelievable" one. He tweeted, "India vs Pakistan is always more than a game...it's an emotion!"  Meanwhile, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne tweeted, "This game is unbelievable!!!" and Dale Steyn wrote, "This game is ridiculous!" India defeated Pakistan on last ball, scoring 16 runs in last over.

138.title: Formula One pays tribute to late Red Bull owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix
138.article_body: Formula One paid tribute to late Red Bull and Red Bull Racing owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix on Sunday. Drivers, teams and fans came together for a minute’s applause to celebrate life of Mateschitz, who died on Saturday. "He was a man who inspired so much...he's the reason...we're here,” Red Bull Racing Team Principal Christian Horner said.

139.title: A jaw-clenching match until the very end: Suresh Raina on India-Pakistan T20 WC match
139.article_body: Talking about India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener in Melbourne, Suresh Raina tweeted, "It has been a jaw-clenching match until the very end, a complete turn of tables bringing victory to Team India." He added, "The energy and fighting spirit showcased by all the players was brilliant. Congratulations on your outstanding win boys!"

140.title: Richard Gould named new England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive
140.article_body: Richard Gould has been named the new chief executive of the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). Gould will begin his new role in January. The son of the former Wales football manager Bobby Gould, he is currently working in football as chief executive at Bristol City Football Club. He has earlier served as chief executive at Somerset and Surrey.

141.title: Turning back time, the chase master Virat Kohli is back: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah
141.article_body: After Virat Kohli slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted, "Turning back time! The chase master Virat Kohli is back and what a match to showcase his skills." He added, "What a game we have witnessed today!" India won the match on the last ball.

142.title: Aman Sehrawat becomes first-ever Indian wrestler to win gold at U-23 World Championships
142.article_body: Aman Sehrawat created history by becoming the first-ever Indian wrestler to win a gold medal at U-23 World Wrestling Championships in Spain's Pontevedra. The 18-year-old defeated Ahmet Duman of Turkey 12-4 in the 57-kg category final. Aman was the lone Indian male freestyle wrestler to get a visa and compete in the tournament.

143.title: What an emotional game tonight: Yuzvendra Chahal on India's win against Pakistan
143.article_body: Reacting to India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Yuzvendra Chahal tweeted, "What an emotional game tonight. The pride we play for." He added, "A stunner of a performance by Virat Kohli. We march on together." Chahal didn't feature in the playing XI against Pakistan. India will next face Netherlands on Thursday.

144.title: Ronaldinho wishes Pelé on his 82nd birthday, shares pic
144.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Ronaldinho took to Twitter to wish Pelé on his 82nd birthday on Sunday. Sharing a picture, he wrote, "Today is the day of the greatest of all...the KING! Happy birthday Pelé...Thank you for so many joys that you gave to all of us!! Long live the king."

145.title: This is why I love this sport: Rashid Khan on India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match
145.article_body: Reacting to India winning their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Pakistan on the last ball, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan tweeted, "This is why I love this sport." He added, "What an exciting game of cricket between two great teams. Top performance Virat Kohli bhai." India scored 16 runs in the last over to win the match.

146.title: When the kingdom falls, the king rises: Amit Mishra on Virat Kohli
146.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli smashing 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, veteran spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "When the kingdom falls, the king rises...Take a bow King Kohli." Kohli's knock helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets. India chased down the 160-run target on the last ball. Kohli slammed six fours and four sixes in the match.

147.title: Babar Azam gives speech in dressing room after defeat against India, PCB shares video
147.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam gave a speech in the dressing room after defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video on Instagram. In the video, Babar can be heard telling players, "We should not fall." He also encouraged Muhammad Nawaz, who gave away 16 runs in the last over against India.

148.title: I think I am a showman: Hardik Pandya after win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup
148.article_body: Following India's victory against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said, "I think I'm a showman. I will not come everyday but when I come I’ll put on a show." He added, "That’s why I messaged my wife and a few closest people and said, 'I don’t know, I just had a gut feeling that tonight is gonna be a special night'."

149.title: We know what Shaheen delivers but he wasn’t really there: Waqar on match against India
149.article_body: Following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said, "We know what Shaheen Afridi delivers but he wasn’t really there." He stated that Shaheen lacked match practice, adding that he should have played in New Zealand ahead of the T20 World Cup. Shaheen Afridi went wicketless in the match.

150.title: Sourav Ganguly pulls out of the race to become the CAB's next chief
150.article_body: Former BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Sunday pulled out of the race to become the Cricket Association of Bengal's next chief. Ganguly said, "I would've been elected uncontested, but I don't think it's right. Others wouldn't have got the opportunity to work for this association. They will be working for these three years now and we will see after that."

151.title: That was incredibly special, my friend: De Villiers to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
151.article_body: Praising his former RCB teammate Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener, former South Africa captain AB de Villiers tweeted, "Virat, that was incredibly special my friend!" He added, "The best of the best." Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in his innings. India beat Pakistan by four wickets.

152.title: India bags a well fought win, special mention to Kohli for a spectacular innings: PM
152.article_body: Reacting to India's victory against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "The India team bags a well fought victory!" He added, "Congratulations for an outstanding performance today. A special mention to Virat Kohli for a spectacular innings in which he demonstrated remarkable tenacity. Best wishes for the games ahead."

153.title: Telangana logs 69 fresh COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
153.article_body: Telangana recorded 69 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state government informed on Sunday, taking the state's total case tally to 8,39,640. Hyderabad reported 43 cases, the highest among all districts in the state. No new deaths due to the infection were reported. Telangana's active case count now stands at 542.

154.title: Bagnaia wins Malaysian GP to extend MotoGP title lead by 23 points
154.article_body: Ducati rider Francesco Bagnaia won the Malaysian Grand Prix to consolidate his lead at the top of the MotoGP board with one race left in the season. Bagnaia has a 23-point lead over Yamaha's Fabio Quartararo, who finished the GP in third place. "I did the best start I ever did in my life. It was perfect," said Bagnaia.

155.title: Use technology, why flare things unnecessarily: Akram on no-ball call in India's last over
155.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said the umpires should have used technology and consulted third umpire to check the waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan in India's last over. "To naked eye, it did not seem like a no-ball but in slow-motion, it does seem like it dipped," he added. He stated, "You have technology. Use it. Why flare up things unnecessarily?"

156.title: ISRO acquires land for new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu
156.article_body: ISRO has acquired land for a proposed new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu where a launch pad would be set up. "The design for the launch pad is ready. Once the land comes into our control...we will commence construction," said ISRO chairman S Somanath. The land is at Kulasekarapatnam in Thoothukudi district, about 650 km from Sriharikota.

157.title: Red alert issued for Assam, Meghalaya after heavy rains predicted
157.article_body: The meteorological department has issued red alerts for Assam and Meghalaya predicting heavy rainfall for three days starting Monday. Due to a depression over the Bay of Bengal, all states in the region will witness, heavy, very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places. IMD said the depression "is very likely" to intensify into a cyclonic storm.

158.title: Kim Jong-un congratulates Xi Jinping for re-election as head of CCP
158.article_body: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un sent a congratulatory letter to Chinese President Xi Jinping upon the latter's re-election as the Chinese Communist Party's (CCP) General secretary, North Korean state media reported. In his message, Kim Jong-un asserted that he would work alongside Xi so that the two leaders can continue to "powerfully propel the socialist cause" in their respective countries.

159.title: Should this be probed: Ali Zafar on waist-high no-ball in India's last over vs Pak
159.article_body: After former Australia spinner Brad Hogg questioned as to why the waist-high no-ball against Pakistan in India's last over was not reviewed, actor-singer Ali Zafar tweeted, "Hmm...This should be probed? I don’t know. What do the experts and the rules say?" He added, "Because that ball was the #turningpoint and @babarazam258 could be seen protesting with the umpires right after."

160.title: We've performed under pressure in past: Stoinis after loss to NZ
160.article_body: After losing to New Zealand by 89 runs on Saturday, Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said that the team knows that they performed under pressure in the past. "There was a bit of hurt in the change room after that [loss]...It's the first game of the WC and if we look after the rest then everything should be fine," Stoinis said.

161.title: Red Bull won 2021 world championship exploiting grey areas: Alonso
161.article_body: Alpine F1's Fernando Alonso said Red Bull exploited "grey areas" to win the 2021 world championship. "This has always been part of F1...people who won the championships...exploiting that grey area," said Alonso. He said Red Bull won't lose the title over their cost cap breach as "nothing happened" when Ferrari won "two races in 2019" with a "not legal" car.

162.title: I spoke to Anushka, she was over the moon: Virat Kohli after India's win vs Pakistan
162.article_body: Following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli said, "I spoke to my wife Anushka, she was over the moon." He added, "She just told me one thing, 'People are so happy. They are calling me to express their happiness'." Kohli slammed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries to help India beat Pakistan.

163.title: Twitter user attributes fake quote regarding India-Pak match to Nasser, he responds
163.article_body: A Twitter user attributed a fake quote regarding India-Pakistan match to former England captain Nasser Hussain. The user claimed Nasser said that "umpires made some weird decision in favour of India". Nasser responded, "Probably best if you can delete this please...it's fake news and a fake quote and definitely not what a great game of cricket like todays deserves!"

164.title: Well done to the king and the rockstar: Karthik on Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya
164.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik penned a note after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "Well done to the king and the rockstar," he wrote for Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya. He added, "Some moments are etched in life, this was one of them for me. Just privileged...to have been a part of this game."

165.title: Why were India awarded 3 byes after Virat Kohli was bowled off free hit vs Pakistan?
165.article_body: India were awarded three byes when Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik ran three runs after Kohli was bowled off free hit in last over against Pakistan. It wasn't a dead ball because on a free hit, a batter can get out only in four ways, which doesn't include bowled. India were awarded the runs as ball was still in play.

166.title: West Bengal logs 75 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
166.article_body: West Bengal recorded 75 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.36% in the last 24 hours, the state health department said on Sunday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. West Bengal's active case count now stands at 3,504, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

167.title: Plan was to form partnership, bat deep: Hardik after win over Pak
167.article_body: After stitching a partnership of 113 runs with Virat Kohli against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that the plan was to form a partnership and bat deep. "We did not have the option of going for big shots as we were four down. We had the belief we could win...I would like to thank everyone who supported me," Hardik said.

168.title: Delhi cracker ban shows Kejriwal is 'anti-religion': Gujarat BJP
168.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil has called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "anti-religious" for his government's decision to ban firecrackers in the national capital. Paatil said Kejriwal and AAP were trying to come to power in Gujarat and asked the gathering he was addressing how they will "burst firecrackers". AAP has said the ban is based on a Supreme Court order.

169.title: Kidnapped 16-yr-old Dalit girl found dead after 4 days in MP
169.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl, who was allegedly kidnapped from her village four days back, was found dead in a field in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district on Sunday. The exact cause of the girl's death is yet to be known, police said. The class 11 student was allegedly kidnapped when she was returning from school on October 19.

170.title: 30 injured after UP-bound bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
170.article_body: At least 30 passengers were injured after a private bus carrying migrant labourers to Uttar Pradesh for Diwali overturned on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, an official said. The bus was coming from Gujarat's Surat, the official added. This comes after 15 people died and 40 others were injured when an UP-bound bus met with an accident on Friday.

171.title: 'Doctor G' is based on true events: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana
171.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his film 'Doctor G' is based on true events. "All of us have seen it a lot of times, even in the news, how doctors are beaten up for no reason...they're just doing their jobs," he stated. "So that is also being shown in the film," the actor added. 'Doctor G' also featured Rakul Preet Singh.

172.title: Southampton hold PL league leaders Arsenal to 1-1 draw at home
172.article_body: Premier League leaders Arsenal were held to a 1-1 draw by Southampton at the Saint Mary's Stadium. Granit Xhaka scored an early goal for Arsenal as Stuart Armstrong netted a second-half equaliser for the home side. This moves Arsenal to 28 points from 11 games, two ahead of Manchester City, while Southampton are 15th with 12 points from 12 games.

173.title: No one doubts Max Verstappen won 2021 F1 world championship: Vettel
173.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Sebastian Vettel said "nobody doubts" that Red Bull's Max Verstappen was the 2021 world champion. Vettel said it would be "stupid" to deduct championship points from Verstappen as punishment for Red Bull breaching the cost cap. "The FIA should come out and make it, very clear, very quick or very soon," said Vettel.

174.title: Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place: Iranian diplomat
174.article_body: While speaking at a conference organised by the J&K People's Justice Front, Iranian Embassy's Cultural Counsellor Dr Muhammad Ali Rabbani on Sunday said that Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place. The conference was organised to highlight the common cultural and heritage relations between India and Iran. Rabbani also lauded India's religious harmony. He also urged Iranians to visit Kashmir.

175.title: 12 arrested for killing elephant calf in Chhattisgarh's Korba
175.article_body: Chhattisgarh forest authorities have arrested 12 persons and detained a minor boy for allegedly killing an elephant calf and burying the carcass in Korba. The accused spotted the calf on October 18 and allegedly poisoned it the next day. Later, a herd of 44 elephants to which the calf belonged went on a rampage and killed a man.
