176.title: For you 'Saat khoon maaf': Javed Akhtar to Virat Kohli over his 82*(53) against Pakistan
176.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) that helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat tum ko saat khoon maaf. Thank you so much. Jeetay raho," he wrote. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah wrote, "A match for the ages! A match that’ll go down in the history books...Well done India."

177.title: Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there: Hardik on stand with Kohli vs Pak
177.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya penned a note on Instagram after India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Hardik, who shared a 113-run stand with Kohli, wrote, "At a loss for words...Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there...One of the best games of my life."

178.title: IMD releases predicted path of cyclone 'Sitrang' in the Bay of Bengal
178.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has shared a picture showing the observed and forecast track of cyclonic storm 'Sitrang'. The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal had intensified into a cyclone at 5.30 pm on Sunday, the IMD said. The cyclone will cross the Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip around October 25 (Tuesday), it added.

179.title: 5 people, including 4 teenage girls, drown in river in Bihar
179.article_body: Four teenage girls and a 40-year-old man drowned in the Punpun River in Hamidnagar village in Bihar's Aurangabad district on Sunday. The incident took place when the four girls aged between 13 and 15 years went to wash their clothes, an official said. Professional divers have been deployed to fish out the bodies, he added.

180.title: Iran's atomic energy agency says info leaked online following hack
180.article_body: Iran's atomic energy agency said that an e-mail server belonging to one of its subsidiaries had been hacked from abroad and information published online, state media reported on Sunday. On Saturday, Iranian hacking group Black Reward said that it had released hacked information relating to Iranian nuclear activities, saying it was done to express solidarity with the ongoing anti-hijab protests.

181.title: Had 'God syndrome' after 'Vicky Donor', felt like I'd arrived: Ayushmann
181.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he developed "God syndrome" after his debut film. "I felt like I had arrived. I think it happens when you get so much...success unexpectedly and you get the 'God syndrome'. However, I have seen several ups and downs in my life," he stated. Ayushmann made his debut with the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'.

182.title: Punjab Speaker to give ₹1 lakh to panchayats not burning stubble
182.article_body: Punjab Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan on Sunday announced that he will give ₹1 lakh to every panchayat if farmers in that village abstain from burning stubble. This amount will be given from his discretionary quota, according to an official statement. "As people [are] getting aware about the harmful effects of stubble burning, they are abandoning this trend," Sandhwan said.

183.title: Man Utd must end relationship with Cristiano Ronaldo: Gary Neville
183.article_body: Former Manchester United captain Gary Neville said the club should "end" its relationship with forward Cristiano Ronaldo. "End it (the contract) this week or create a truce to get to the World Cup and then end it...It has to end," said Neville. He added that the club is "better without" Cristiano and manager "Erik ten Hag knows that".

184.title: 20,000 yaba tablets being smuggled to Bangladesh seized in Assam
184.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was arrested and as many as 20,000 yaba tablets were recovered from him in Assam's Karimganj district on Sunday. The seizure was made from a car while the drugs was being smuggled to Bangladesh. The action was taken by the BSF, vigilant troops of Mizoram and Cachar Frontier, police said.

185.title: Deep depression over Bay of Bengal intensifies into cyclonic storm ‘Sitrang’
185.article_body: The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' on Sunday evening. It will make landfall between Tinkona Island and Sandwip close to Bangladesh's Barisal in the early hours of Tuesday. The cyclone is likely to bring heavy to very heavy rain in coastal districts of South 24 Parganas and North 24 Parganas on Monday.

186.title: Hasbulla jokingly punches Ranveer Singh at UFC 280, actor shares video
186.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who attended UFC 280 in Abu Dhabi, took to Instagram Stories and shared a video with Hasbulla. In the video, Hasbulla can be seen punching Ranveer jokingly. Along with the video, Ranveer wrote, "Hasbulla taking no prisoners." Ranveer also shared pictures with Steven Seagal and Steve Harvey, who also attended the event.

187.title: Credit to Hardik, Virat for their performances: Pak skipper Babar
187.article_body: Despite losing to India by four wickets, Pakistan skipper Babar Azam said that his team bowled really well. "All credit to Kohli and Pandya. It wasn't easy with the new ball. We had partnerships after 10 overs," Babar said. "We had a lot of positives [from the match especially,] the way Iftikhar played and the way Shan played," he added.

188.title: France defender Varane's injury less serious than feared: Reports
188.article_body: Manchester United's French defender Raphael Varane's injury is reportedly "less serious than feared" and he can "still have hope" of playing in the World Cup. Varane left the pitch in tears with a leg injury during United's 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Saturday. Reports say Varane is expected to be out injured for between three and four weeks.

189.title: Very happy with my bowling: Arshdeep after taking 3 for 32
189.article_body: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh said he is very happy with his bowling after the 23-year-old cricketer took three scalps against Pakistan in Melbourne on Sunday. "I didn't work too much on myself, just trying to keep things simple...We were talking..that we will take wickets in the starting and will restrict Pakistan...All credit goes to our batters," Arshdeep said.

190.title: Story for future generations: Ayushmann on watching final overs of IND vs PAK in flight
190.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Sunday recounted his experience of watching the final overs of today's match where India beat Pakistan, on a Mumbai-Chandigarh flight. Khurrana said, "This story is for my future generations." He said, "I've never witnessed a collective uproar of applause inside an aircraft...Thank you team India and Virat (Kohli) for bringing in Diwali a day early."

191.title: My best knock ever in T20Is, I'm lost for words: Virat Kohli on his 82*(53) against Pak
191.article_body: Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, said it's his best knock ever in T20I cricket. "I have no words, no idea how that happened. I am really lost for words," he added. He stated that his previous best knock was 82*(51) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2016.

192.title: 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match at MCG
192.article_body: As many as 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the ICC said. Reacting to the ICC's post on Twitter, a fan tweeted, "90,293 lucky people witnessed Greatest of All Time cricket match." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets by completing the chase on the last ball of the match.

193.title: Have lost my voice screaming: Sushmita Sen after India's win over Pak
193.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022, actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter and congratulated the team. "WHAT A GAME...Salute Virat Kohli, have lost my voice screaming!" Abhishek Bachchan also took to Twitter and wrote, "King Kohli!!! That's the tweet." Kohli scored 53-ball 82 in the match against Pakistan.

194.title: Kohli, Hardik break record of highest partnership for India against Pakistan in T20Is
194.article_body: Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya on Sunday broke the record for registering the highest partnership for India in a T20I against Pakistan. Kohli and Hardik registered a 113-run fifth-wicket stand to break the record. The previous record was held by MS Dhoni and Yuvraj Singh, who had recorded a 97-run fourth-wicket stand against Pakistan in a T20I in 2012.

195.title: Shoaib Akhtar shares pic to question umpires for giving no-ball in India's last over
195.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a picture to question umpires for giving a waist-high no-ball in India’s last over against Pakistan in T20 World Cup, apparently suggesting it shouldn’t have been called a no-ball. “Umpire bhaiyo...food for thought aaj raat k liye (Umpires...food for thought for tonight),” Akhtar wrote. Kohli slammed a six off the no-ball bowled by Muhammad Nawaz.

196.title: India equal Aus' record for achieving highest target in last 3 overs of a T20 WC match
196.article_body: India on Sunday equalled Australia's record for achieving the highest target in the last three overs of a T20 World Cup match. India chased down 48 runs in the last three overs against Pakistan to equal the record. Australia had also chased 48 runs off last three overs against Pakistan in a T20 World Cup 2010 match.

197.title: So inspiring to see Virat Kohli cry and smile: Shah Rukh Khan on India's win vs Pakistan
197.article_body: Following India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "So good to see a great game of cricket. So wonderful to see India win." He added, "So brilliant to see Virat Kohli batting...and so inspiring to see him cry and smile...and the background score of Chak de India!! Happy Diwali starts right now!!!"

198.title: Irfan Pathan shares video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase vs Pakistan
198.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to share a video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022. He wrote, "What scenes here at the MCG. Even the great Sunny ji couldn’t stop dancing...Virat you are the real king." "Look at Sunny bhai's enthusiasm," an Instagram user commented.

199.title: To divert public attention: Cong MP on action against Rajiv Gandhi Foundation
199.article_body: After the central government cancelled the FCRA licences of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF) and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RGCT), Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said the move is aimed at "defaming the Congress". "They (Centre) recycle old charges against the RGF and RGCT. This is to...divert public attention from issues of day-to-day concern faced by them," Ramesh added.

200.title: 'Rishi Sunak isn't even British', says racist caller on UK radio station; host responds
200.article_body: A racist caller joined a UK radio station and said, "Rishi Sunak isn't going to win the next general election...He's not even British." The show's host Sangita Myska immediately corrected the man, and said, "Rishi Sunak was born in the UK...I think you are fundamentally a racist." Notably, Indian-origin Sunak has formally declared he's running for the UK PM's post.

201.title: The MCG pitch for Ind-Pak game had something in it: Rohit Sharma
201.article_body: After winning the game by four wickets against Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said that the pitch had something in it. "There was a nice carry. Some swing and seam. Good to see from the bowling perspective...We knew we had to bat out of our skin to chase this," Rohit said.

202.title: Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi criticises minister who slapped woman
202.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi criticised Karnataka Minister V Somanna for allegedly slapping a woman during a public event. "BJP Minister. Karnataka. Likely explanation: Not a slap on the face but blessings on the cheek," she added. Chaturvedi also accused the government and the National Commission for Women of being silent on the issue.

203.title: Deadline to submit bids for Future Retail extended to November 3
203.article_body: As per the modified invitation of expression of interest (EoI) for Future Retail, which is undergoing the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process, the final date to submit bids has been extended to November 3. The final list of prospective buyers will be published on November 20, and the deadline for the submission of the resolution plan is December 15.

204.title: RPF officials save woman who fell from moving train while deboarding; video surfaces
204.article_body: A video showing a woman slipping while deboarding a train at Muzaffarpur station in Bihar has surfaced on social media. The video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), shows RPF officials pulling her just as she was about to fall in gap between platform and train and be crushed under its wheels. She had reportedly boarded the train to defecate.

205.title: Kohli's best innings for India: Rohit on Virat's 82*(53) vs Pak
205.article_body: After Indian batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53) against Pakistan on Sunday, skipper Rohit Sharma said that this was the best innings that Kohli has played for his country. "Taking the game deep was very critical...We were in no position to [get that target]. The way we won is more pleasing to us. Hats off to Virat" Rohit said.

206.title: Russian, British defence ministers discuss the situation in Ukraine
206.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Sunday discussed the situation in Ukraine with his British counterpart, Ben Wallace, over a telephone call, Russian media reported, citing the defence ministry. During the call, Shoigu reportedly conveyed Moscow's apprehension regarding Kyiv's plan to use a "dirty bomb" in Ukraine. Russia has provided no evidence regarding the claim about Kyiv's intention.

207.title: UK's destiny lies in Europe, Brexit sold as a 'mirage': EU official
207.article_body: EU's industry chief Thierry Breton on Sunday said Britain's destiny lies in Europe and that Brexit was sold to the country as "a sort of mirage". Breton said this while speaking about the current political turmoil in the UK. "We have a country which is completely destabilised, and a political party as well," Breton added, referring to the Conservative Party.

208.title: Virat Kohli, you are special: Shahid Kapoor after India's win over Pak
208.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of Virat Kohli after the latter scored a match-winning 53-ball 82 runs against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat, you are special. Thank you for today. If you believe and if you persevere, you become the vessel through which the world witnesses magic," Shahid captioned the post.

209.title: Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man: Ravi Shastri on Virat Kohli
209.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last delivery in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Ravi Shastri shared a picture of Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli. Praising Kohli for his 82*(53), Shastri wrote, "Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man @virat.kohli." Kohli came to bat in the second over after KL Rahul's dismissal.

210.title: Ayodhya sets Guinness World Record as nearly 16 lakh diyas lit, pics released
210.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday shared pictures as 15.76 lakh lamps were lit in Ayodhya on the eve of Diwali, in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "World record re-established...Ayodhya entered the Guinness Book of World Records," said a UP Tourism Twitter page. PM Modi launched the Deepotsav celebrations on the banks of the river Sarayu on Sunday.

211.title: Sehwag shares PM Modi's 'Rona band kijiye' meme for Pakistan after their loss to India
211.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share PM Narendra Modi's 'Aap log rona band kijiye (Please stop crying)' meme for Pakistan after their defeat to India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Request to neighbours," he captioned. "I hope they don't break TVs today," a Team India fan commented on his post on Instagram.

212.title: If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky: RP Singh on Virat Kohli
212.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli for smashing 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022, former India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky." Meanwhile, Merv Hughes tweeted, "How good Virat!!!! Outstanding!!" "Virat Kohli well and truly back to his best," wrote Ian Bishop.

213.title: There was no slap: Woman allegedly 'hit' by Karnataka minister
213.article_body: The woman who was allegedly slapped by Karnataka minister and BJP MLA V Somanna refuted the allegations saying "there was no slap". "I went there to ask for help and requested him to give land. At the same time, I fell on his feet and somebody said [Somanna] slapped me," she said. "It's just an allegation against [Somanna]," she added.

214.title: 'Sabka sath, sabka vikas' inspired by Lord Ram's values: PM Modi
214.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the 'Deepotsav' celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya on Sunday said the concept of 'sabka saath, sabka vikas' was drawn from the values inculcated by Lord Ram. PM Modi addressed a gathering at the Ram Katha park ahead of Diwali. He also offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the temporary Ram temple.

215.title: Salman Rushdie has lost sight in one eye, one hand incapacitated: Agent
215.article_body: Salman Rushdie has lost vision in one eye and one of his hands is incapacitated, his agent said in an update two months after the India-born author was attacked and stabbed multiple times in New York. "He had three serious wounds in his neck. One hand is incapacitated because the nerves in his arm were cut," Rushdie's agent added.

216.title: 7 including 2 minors arrested over software engineer's gang-rape in J'khand
216.article_body: Seven people, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 26-year-old software engineer in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, according to police. The arrests were made after interrogating some local residents who frequented the area in Chaibasa, where the incident took place, police added. The woman's wallet and mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

217.title: Scheduled outages introduced in Kyiv after strikes on energy infra
217.article_body: Scheduled "stabilisation" power cuts were introduced in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv on Sunday "to avoid accidents" following repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Kyiv's power operator DTEK said during the day. The outages should last "no more than four hours" but may be longer "due to the scale of damage to the power supply system", DTEK added.

218.title: Been a beautiful year: Radhika Madan on completing 'Soorarai...' remake
218.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan took to Instagram Stories and shared a picture from the sets of her untitled film with actor Akshay Kumar. "It's a wrap for project number five of this year! It's been a beautiful beautiful year guys. Can't wait to see you at the movies," Radhika wrote. The film is a remake of the Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'.

219.title: Pakistan will not agree for neutral venue for 2023 Asia Cup: Engineer
219.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-cricketer Farokh Engineer said that Pakistan won't agree to hold the tournament at a neutral venue. "They (Pakistan) need the resources and foreign teams to play in Pakistan. They have been deprived of cricket for a long time," Engineer said.

220.title: One of the greatest victories under pressure: Rahul on Ind-Pak match
220.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi congratulated the Indian team for its victory over Pakistan by four wickets in Melbourne on Sunday. "What a thriller of a match against Pakistan...One of the greatest victories under pressure. Well done team India...Best of luck for the matches ahead [in the T20 World Cup]," Rahul tweeted. Notably, batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53).

221.title: Russia's 2 largest banks open vostro account for overseas Rupee trade
221.article_body: Russia's two largest banks, Sberbank and VTB Bank, have opened special vostro accounts following permission from the Reserve Bank of India to facilitate overseas trade in Rupee. The banks have reportedly opened these accounts in their branches in Delhi. The vostro account enables settlement of payments in rupee for trade between India and Russia, enabling cross-border trade in Rupee.

222.title: I'm sorry if anyone felt hurt: K'taka minister as video shows him slapping woman
222.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman surfaced online, the minister said, "Though I did not misbehave at all but if anyone felt hurt then I apologise and express my regret." "I was trying to make her stand aside, indicating her with my hand. There was no other intention...I have high regards for women," Somanna added.

223.title: Cricket can be cruel and unfair: Ramiz Raja after India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup
223.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja tweeted, "A classic!" He added, "You win some, you lose some and as we all know this game can be cruel and unfair. #TeamPakistan couldn't have given more with bat and ball. Very proud of the effort!"

224.title: Hardik breaks down remembering late father after India's last-ball win vs Pak
224.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya broke down remembering his late father after India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "He left his city and came to another city for cricket career of his sons. It's a huge thing," Hardik said. Hardik's father passed away in January 2021 due to heart attack.

225.title: PM Narendra Modi launches Deepotsav celebrations in UP's Ayodhya
225.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday launched the Deepotsav celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, on the eve of the festival of Diwali. "Lord Ram doesn't leave anyone behind, doesn't turn away from anyone," PM Modi said. Over 15 lakh earthen lamps will be lit as part of Deepotsav celebrations by over 22,000 volunteers, said Ayodhya Divisional Commissioner Navdeep Rinwa.

226.title: It hurt: Vijay Varma on losing 'Kai Po Che' to Sushant Singh Rajput
226.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma revealed he had auditioned for a role in the 2013 film 'Kai Po Che', which was eventually played by late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. "It hurt at that time but I've seen...actors who come up to me and say 'I wanted to do that role, you were doing'," he added. Vijay also auditioned for 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag'.

227.title: Raj Police share 'Diwali Dhamaka' poster to warn those spreading fake news
227.article_body: Rajasthan Police on Sunday shared a 'Diwali Dhamaka' to warn against sharing messages that may disturb communal harmony. "Free! Free! Free! Rajasthan Police's special offer on Diwali. One mistake can make you take a trip to the jail, and that too for free," it added. Police also urged people to light firecrackers in open spaces and not inside their homes.

228.title: Apple to run app-related ads on App Store from Oct 25
228.article_body: Apple announced that it will run app-related advertisements on App Store in the Today tab from October 25 in all countries except China. On its website, Apple wrote, "With a Today tab ad, your app can appear prominently on the front page of the App Store." The Today tab had no paid placement options previously.

229.title: Apple starts paying out $100 million fund to App Store developers: Report
229.article_body: Apple has reportedly started paying out $100 million cash reserve created as part of a class-action settlement to its App Store developers. The company agreed to create the Apple Smart Developer Assistance Fund under a lawsuit brought by the US developers concerned with App Store policies. Eligible developers stood to get paid from $250 to $30,000 under the settlement.

230.title: Man cheated of ₹3.5 crore over currency notes in Navi Mumbai
230.article_body: The CBD Belapur police in Navi Mumbai has filed a case against over half a dozen people for cheating a Gujarat businessman of ₹3.5 crore. The fraudsters promised the businessman to help him convert old currency notes into new ones that he could give as Diwali bonuses to employees. They later staged an 'arrest' to run away with the money.

231.title: Tree House Education gets clean chit in misstatements of financial case
231.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given a clean chit to Tree House Education  & Accessories Ltd, its promoters and other officials in an alleged financial misstatements case after a financial audit. In a letter, SEBI said that since a forensic audit showed no instances of any financial misgivings, no action will be taken.

232.title: 29 wagons of goods train derail in UP, 20 other trains affected
232.article_body: As many as 29 wagons of a goods train derailed at Ramwa station near Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur on Sunday morning, disrupting the movement of 20 other trains on the route. Railway engineers said that work to clear the track is underway and traffic on the route is expected to return to normalcy by evening.

233.title: ICC shares pics of moments after India's last-ball win vs Pak, says 'Etched in history'
233.article_body: The ICC took to official Twitter account of T20 World Cup 2022 to share pictures of moments after Ravichandran Ashwin scored a single on the last ball to help India beat Pakistan in their Super 12 match. "Etched in history," the ICC captioned the post. India scored 16 runs off the last over to win the match by four wickets.

234.title: Soap and oil actors leave their shoots to film for ads: Subhash Ghai
234.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the current generation of actors, has said that the "soap and oil" actors leave their shoots to film for advertisements. "The actors of the 90s still understand the importance of the story...today's generation wants the money to come first, they're just bothered about their personal branding and fees," he added.

235.title: Google removes apps from Play Store for performing ad fraud: Report
235.article_body: Google has removed 16 apps from Play Store which were performing ad fraud as they were impersonating a real user by clicking on ads and redirecting to web pages in the background, a security firm alleged. These apps were also causing faster battery drain and high data usage on Android devices. They had 20 million downloads before they were removed.

236.title: Kerala Governor seeks resignations of VCs of 9 universities
236.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday sought the resignations of vice-chancellors of nine universities in the state. He directed the VCs that the resignations should reach him by 11.30 am on Monday. The Governor upheld a recent Supreme Court order quashing the appointment of the VCs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University for being contrary to UGC regulations.

237.title: Rohit Sharma lifts Virat Kohli in joy after India beat Pakistan, pics go viral
237.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma lifted Virat Kohli in joy after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Pictures and videos showing the same went viral on social media. In one of the videos, Rohit can be seen running towards Kohli and lifting him up, while Hardik Pandya can be seen clapping.

238.title: Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country: Sunil Chhetri
238.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli after the latter slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country...Happy Diwali, India," Chhetri wrote. India completed their 160-run chase against Pakistan on the last ball.

239.title: Kohli shares pics from India vs Pak T20 World Cup match, calls it a 'Special win'
239.article_body: Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share pictures from India versus Pakistan T20 World Cup match held in Melbourne on Sunday. "Special win. Thank you to all our fans for turning up in numbers," Kohli captioned the pictures. Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) against Pakistan, said, "I rank this innings as my best."

240.title: Which states & UTs have imposed curbs on firecrackers during Diwali this year?
240.article_body: Delhi and Haryana have banned the sale, purchase and use of fireworks on Diwali, with Haryana making an exception for green firecrackers. The Punjab government has allowed the bursting of crackers during the 8 pm-10 pm window, while in Tamil Nadu crackers can be burst during two one-hour windows. Bihar also banned crackers in Patna and two other cities.

241.title: Netflix to open gaming studio, seeks to explore cloud gaming
241.article_body: Netflix has decided to open its fifth gaming studio in Southern California as it looks to seriously explore a cloud gaming offering, company's Vice President, gaming, Mike Verdu said. Verdu added that Netflix is looking at the cloud gaming service as a "value add" and not as a "console replacement". At its studios, Netflix has 14 games in full development.

242.title: Undoubtedly the best innings of your life: Sachin to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
242.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his match-winning 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "It was undoubtedly the best innings of your life. It was a treat to watch you play, the six off back foot in 19th over against Rauf over long-on was spectacular!" Sachin wrote.

243.title: Fighter jet crashes into residential building in Russia's Irkutsk
243.article_body: A Russian fighter jet crashed into a residential building in Russia's Irkutsk city on Sunday, killing both pilots, Irkutsk region's governor said. The aircraft has been identified as a Sukhoi Su-30, which officials say was on a test flight. No one on the ground was hurt, as per authorities. Another Sukhoi jet crashed in Russia's Yeysk city earlier this week.

244.title: 35-yr-old man pushed from running train by Govt Reserve Police in UP; dies
244.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Arun Bhuiyan, died after he was allegedly pushed from a moving train by Government Reserve Police (GRP) officials near Unchdih railway station in Uttar Pradesh. According to a complaint filed by Bhuiyan's friend, an argument broke out between GRP officials and Bhuiyan. The argument then led to two GRP officials throwing Bhuiyan out of the train.

245.title: Mumbai-based NGO finds banned toxic chemicals in city's firecrackers
245.article_body: A Mumbai-based NGO conducted independent tests on firecrackers in the city and claimed some of them contain banned chemicals such as arsenic, sulphur, barium and chlorine. The NGO has written to the police and Maharashtra government on the same. They also conducted a noise test on the crackers and found that they all fell within the permissible 120-decibel limit.

246.title: You freaking beauty, you've brought joy on the eve of Diwali: Anushka on Virat
246.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma, the wife of cricketer Virat Kohli, took to Instagram to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup as Kohli smashed 82*(53). "You freaking beauty!! You've brought sooooo much joy in people's lives tonight and that too on the eve of Diwali," she said. "I've just watched the best match of my life," she added.

247.title: 3 dead, 8 injured in attack on hotel in Somalia's Kismayo
247.article_body: A blast hit a hotel in Somalia's port city of Kismayo when an explosives-laden car rammed into the hotel's gate on Sunday, following which gunfire erupted at the scene, according to police officials. At least three people were killed in the attack and eight others were injured, as per authorities. Militant group al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

248.title: Shivling scene in 'Baahubali' created no controversy as it was respectful: Amish
248.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi opened up about the 'Shivling' scene from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and said that the scene created no controversy. "It's one of the most iconic scenes in Indian cinema. It's a very respectful scene, viewers can see the intention," Amish added. In the scene, Prabhas breaks the base of 'Shivling' and carries it to the waterfall.

249.title: Banks financing Musk's Twitter deal to not sell debt to investors: Report
249.article_body: Banks providing $13 billion in financing for billionaire Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter have abandoned plans to sell the debt to investors because of uncertainty around Twitter's fortunes and losses, Reuters reported. Banks are reportedly planning to keep the debt on their balance sheets until there's more investor interest. Debt package for the Twitter deal is comprised of junk-rated loans.

250.title: Nasdaq pauses IPOs of small Chinese firms amid stock rallies probe
250.article_body: The IPOs of at least four small Chinese companies have been put on hold by Nasdaq as it investigates the short-lived stock rallies after the debut of these firms. Nasdaq has informed lawyers and bankers that some IPOs will not proceed "until they determined what has been the aberrational trading activity in certain Chinese issuers earlier this year".

251.title: Haryana govt declares 50% VAT rebate for industrial units using natural gas
251.article_body: The Haryana government announced that it has decided to offer a 50% rebate in value-added tax to industrial units that will replace diesel generators with natural gas. The scheme will be applicable to entire industry including micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). The finance committee also approved a yearly subsidy of ₹164.66 crore to EV manufacturing companies under various heads.

252.title: My heart couldn't take that anymore: Rishad Premji as India beats Pak in T20 WC
252.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate Virat Kohli and the Indian Cricket Team for their win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said, "My heart couldn't take that anymore." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in Melbourne. Rishad Premji further added, "Truly amazing - team India and Virat Kohli!!"

253.title: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on FCRA licence cancellation
253.article_body: BJP welcomed the cancellation of the FCRA licences of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RCGT) associated with the Gandhi family for allegedly violating the foreign funding law. The party said that the Gandhi family and organisations linked to it cannot be above the law. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra claimed the action "exposed" Gandhi family's corruption.

254.title: Dr Reddy's, Cipla & Aurobindo Pharma's US-based units recall products
254.article_body: US-based unit of Dr Reddy's Laboratories is recalling 2,838 ampules of vitamin K deficiency treatment drug due to "failed stability specifications", according to the US Food and Drug Administration. Cipla is recalling 9,041 cartons of a COPD medicine due to "lack of assurance of sterility". Aurobindo Pharma's US unit is recalling 80,080 vials of injection used to control heavy bleeding.

255.title: FPIs sell Indian equities worth nearly ₹6,000 crore in October
255.article_body: The data with the depositories showed that foreign investors have sold Indian equities worth ₹5,992 crore in October (till 21) as the dollar strengthened against the rupee. The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) has reached ₹1.75 lakh crore so far in 2022. However, according to data, FPIs had slowed down their selling substantially during the last few days.

256.title: ICC shares graphic after Kohli helps India beat Pakistan, tweets 'The King is back'
256.article_body: After Virat Kohli's 82*(53) helped India defeat Pakistan on last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, the official Twitter handle of ICC shared a graphic showing Kohli sitting on a throne. "The King is back...Take a bow, Virat Kohli," the ICC wrote. Kohli's innings included six fours and four sixes.

257.title: Virat Kohli punches ground, tears up after India defeat Pakistan on last ball, video viral
257.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli tearing up after Team India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne on Sunday. The video also shows Kohli punching the ground after his 82*(53) helped India chase down the 160-run target. Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in the match.

258.title: 'Adipurush' director releases new poster of Prabhas on actor's b'day
258.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut has released a new poster of actor Prabhas as Lord Ram on the occasion of the actor's 43rd birthday. Taking to Instagram, Raut shared the poster and wrote, "Maryada Purushottam Prabhu Shree Ram." Prabhas also shared the poster on his Instagram account. Recently, the film's teaser was trolled on Twitter over its VFX.

259.title: Deepawali begins: Amit Shah after India defeats Pakistan in T20 World Cup
259.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah took to Twitter on Sunday to congratulate the Indian cricket team for defeating Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne. "A perfect way to start the T20 World Cup...Deepawali begins," Shah tweeted. "What a cracking innings by Virat Kohli. Congratulations to the entire team," he added.

260.title: PM Modi offers prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya
260.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali on Sunday. Modi arrived in Ayodhya to attend Deepotsav celebrations, during which around 18 lakh earthen lamps will be lit to celebrate Diwali. PM Modi was welcomed by Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath.

261.title: Mobile phone suddenly explodes during repair in UP; video goes viral
261.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media which showed a mobile phone suddenly exploding while it was being repaired at a mobile shop in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur. Reportedly, the mobile was brought in for repair due to a problem with its charging. The shopkeeper and two others had a narrow escape in the incident.

262.title: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to visit India in Nov: Reports
262.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will reportedly visit India on November 14 while on his way to the G20 summit in Bali, Indonesia. The Crown Prince is visiting India on the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and it will be a day-long visit, reports citing sources said. Last week, Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman visited India.

263.title: China will open its door wider to the world: Xi Jinping
263.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday said his country will open its door wider to the rest of the world. "China cannot develop in isolation from the world. The world's development also needs China," Xi stated. This came as Xi secured a third term as the Chinese Communist Party's head, making him the most influential party leader since Mao Zedong.

264.title: India defeat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup as Virat Kohli smashes 82*(53)
264.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday. India chased down the 160-run target as Virat Kohli smashed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries. India have now won nine out of 12 T20I matches against Pakistan.

265.title: No women in China's Politburo for the first time in 25 years
265.article_body: The Chinese Communist Party's decision-making body, Politburo, will have no women members for the first time in 25 years. Sun Chunlan, the only woman sitting on the previous Politburo, has retired. China will be ruled by an all-male Politburo for the next five years as President Xi Jinping secures a historic third term in power.

266.title: Don't insult common man by calling facilities 'revdi': Kejriwal to PM
266.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Narendra Modi to not insult the common man by calling facilities of free education and treatment as "revdi". Tweeting a report of PM Modi slamming the political culture of "revdi" or freebies, Kejriwal said, "People are quite worried due to inflation. Why should they not get free education, treatment, medicines and electricity?"

267.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan celebrates Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
267.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan celebrated Diwali eve at his residence with COVID orphans who lost their parents during the pandemic. He extended Diwali greetings to the children and was also seen dancing with them. According to the reports, 315 children were present in the programme. He planted saplings with the children before the beginning of the celebrations.

268.title: Mob thrashes suspected cattle smuggler, sets his vehicle on fire
268.article_body: A mob thrashed a man over the suspicion of smuggling cattle in West Bengal's Howrah. The mob set his vehicle, allegedly used for the act, on fire. "Locals witnessed a few cattle smugglers taking an ox in their wagon. One accused was caught and handed over to the police, while the rest are absconding," a local resident said.

269.title: Ludhiana civic body carries out trials for anti-smog guns ahead of Diwali
269.article_body: In view of rising pollution levels, the municipal corporation has begun conducting trials for anti-smog guns across different parts of Ludhiana. Attached with tractors, generator and a water tanker, the guns were taken through the city’s main roads and markets as part of the trials. Authorities said the anti-smog guns will be stationed at certain points after Diwali.

270.title: Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma to become highest run-scorer in T20I cricket
270.article_body: Former India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday overtook India captain Rohit Sharma to become the highest run-getter in T20I cricket. After scoring his first 30 runs in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Kohli overtook Rohit's tally of 3,741 runs. Kohli is playing his 102nd innings in T20I cricket.

271.title: Will have low-key Diwali celebrations among family members: Randhir
271.article_body: Actor Randhir Kapoor shared that the Kapoor family will have "low-key" Diwali celebrations. "We are meeting each other...When we meet, that itself becomes a party as we're a very big family," he shared. Randhir added that the family will have a get-together at Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's house on Sunday evening.

272.title: BJP and RSS were trying to rewrite India's history: Cong MLA Abdur Rashid
272.article_body: Assam Congress MLA Abdur Rashid Mandal criticised the BJP and the RSS and alleged that both organisations were trying to rewrite the history of India. "[They] are now trying to create a fake history of the country. Everyone knows the history of India. When the BJP-RSS are rewriting India's history, it is only a history [of hate]," said Mandal.

273.title: Won’t let BJP turn K’taka into lab of hatred, misgovernance: Rahul
273.article_body: Congress won't allow Karnataka to be turned into a laboratory for BJP’s experiments with hatred and misgovernance, party leader Rahul Gandhi said. "Through untiring efforts of our state leaders, drawing on rich cultures of Karnataka and support of crores of Kannadigas, that day will soon come when we will unleash Karnataka’s true potential through the path of love...harmony," he added.

274.title: India record their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in T20I cricket history
274.article_body: India today recorded their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in a T20I. India were restricted to 45/4 in first 10 overs by Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. India lost wickets of Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel within the first seven overs. India's previous lowest 10-over score in a T20I against Pakistan was 53/3.

275.title: K'taka withdraws order to collect ₹100 donation from govt school students
275.article_body: The Karnataka government has withdrawn an order to collect ₹100 as monthly donations from students to develop government primary and high schools. The order, which was issued earlier this month, has been criticised by parents and opposition parties. "After looting 40% commission from government coffers, they now want to loot from the parents too," Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

276.title: Hardik, Rohit get angry as spider cam denies India a potential wicket vs Pak, video viral
276.article_body: A video went viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya getting angry after spider cam denied India a potential wicket of Pakistan's Shan Masood in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Masood had lofted a Ravichandran Ashwin delivery which went on to hit spider cam wire before landing in no-man's land. Masood scored 52*(42) in the innings.

277.title: Happiest Minds fires 'few' employees for moonlighting, calls it 'unacceptable'
277.article_body: Bengaluru-based IT services firm Happiest Minds Technologies fired a "few" employees who were found to be moonlighting, company executive Joseph Anantharaju told PTI. "[Moonlighting] is something we will not accept...because when you sign a contract or employment offer, you are agreeing to work only for that company," he said. Moonlighting practice is "not too pervasive" at the company, he added.

278.title: Telegram to auction usernames for 700 million users via blockchain
278.article_body: Telegram has announced that it'll auction off usernames for 700 million users on its messaging app via its blockchain-based platform. Telegram said it would use The Open Network blockchain to host the auction. "This would create a new platform where username holders could transfer them to interested parties in protected deals," said Telegram Founder Pavel Durov.

279.title: Some of us from different parties will join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maha: Pawar
279.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said he will participate in Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra wherever possible when it enters Maharashtra. "Bharat Jodo Yatra is a Congress party programme but through this, an attempt is being made to bring harmony in society. So, some of us from different parties will join the march wherever possible when it's in Maharashtra," Pawar said.

280.title: Sonu Sood to make writing debut with action-thriller film 'Fateh'
280.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood will be making his writing debut with his upcoming action-thriller film 'Fateh'. "Personally, I have worked a lot on script and screenplay...But I'll take the credit for this for the first time," Sood said. He shared that the film revolves around the issue of digital scams for which the team has been consulting with ethical hackers.

281.title: The team deserves applause for their efforts: MP Medical Education Minister
281.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Medical Education Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang, while talking about Hindi MBBS books said "the entire...team deserves applause for their relentless efforts for over six months to make it happen". "Those raising questions on introduction of Hindi in MBBS courses should know that the system which is going to be...implemented for the first time...is a revolutionary step," he added.

282.title: 21 kg heroin seized from truck on Jammu-Srinagar highway, driver detained
282.article_body: A truck driver was detained on Sunday after 18 packets of heroin, weighing around 21.5 kg, were seized from his vehicle on Jammu-Srinagar national highway in J&K’s Udhampur. The seized contraband is worth crores of rupees in the international market, an official said. "During checking...at Zero Point on the highway at Chenani, truck coming from Kashmir…was intercepted," the official stated.

283.title: RSS leader pays visit to Delhi's Nizamuddin Dargah ahead of Diwali
283.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar visited Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in New Delhi and lit earthen lamps inside the premises of the shrine. "The festival of Diwali is celebrated in the world, including India...This festival erases all the religious differences...Everyone should follow their own religion and caste. Do not criticise and insult others' religions," said Kumar.

284.title: Pune man tries stealing power for Diwali stall, dies
284.article_body: While attempting to steal electricity for a Diwali stall set up by a woman in Aundh, a Pune man died of electrocution. The deceased, identified as Pravin Ashok Mane, tried to steal electricity from a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) feeder pillar. The woman and the deceased were booked under IPC and the Electricity Act.

285.title: Delhi records 'poor' air quality for 8th straight day ahead of Diwali
285.article_body: The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the 'poor' category for the eighth consecutive day on Sunday as smog engulfed Delhi and neighbouring areas. The overall AQI in Delhi was recorded at 243 at 10 am on Sunday. It was around 265 on Saturday evening. The air quality is likely to deteriorate in the coming days.

286.title: Gurugram records 2nd highest number of dengue cases in last 7 yrs
286.article_body: After four new dengue cases were reported in Gurugram on Saturday, the district took its total tally of cases to 337 for this year, while 327 cases were reported last year. This is the second-highest number of dengue cases recorded in the district in the last seven years. The worst-hit areas have been Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar, Pataudi and Ghangola, among others.

287.title: 2 more people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
287.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said two more people, who were admitted in an isolation unit of the country's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala, had tested positive for Ebola. On Saturday, the ministry reported three confirmed cases from the same hospital. The five confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in Kampala.

288.title: Robbie Coltrane's death certificate reveals multiple causes including sepsis & diabetes
288.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who passed away recently, died from a series of conditions including multiple organ failure, sepsis, lower respiratory tract infection and heart block. According to his death certificate, the actor also suffered from diabetes and obesity. Coltrane, who was famous for his role as Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, had been unwell for some time.

289.title: Interpol launches world's first global police Metaverse
289.article_body: International crime control organisation Interpol has launched the world's first global police Metaverse for law enforcement officials to increase cooperation. Users of this Metaverse can interact with each other and even take training courses on forensic investigation and other policing capabilities. Interpol will also create an expert group to represent officials' views on security in Metaverse.

290.title: Shameless man should be sacked: Jairam after K’taka minister slaps woman
290.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman during a public event was widely shared online, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted, "This shameless man should be sacked immediately!" Furthermore, he said, "What a difference from the way Rahul Gandhi began the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra from the very same Gundlupet on 30th September!"

291.title: Kheda caning victims file case against police officers in Gujarat HC
291.article_body: The Gujarat High Court issued a notice to 15 police personnel allegedly involved in the public flogging of Muslim men in Kheda district earlier this month. The five victims who filed the case were accused of pelting stones during a garba event. They also claimed that the police violated Supreme Court's directions on how to deal with people in custody.

292.title: Palestinian group says its member killed by Israel in 'targeted explosion'
292.article_body: A senior member of the Palestinian militant group "Den of Lions" was killed overnight on Sunday in a "targeted explosion" carried out by Israel, according to the group. Tamer Kilani was killed in West Bank's Nablus city when a bomb placed on a motorcycle parked nearby was detonated, the group informed. The Israeli military declined to comment on the explosion.

293.title: Haven't seen a film like this: Vivek Agnihotri on 'Kantara'
293.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri said he hasn't seen a film like 'Kantara', which he called Rishab Shetty's "masterpiece" and a film that is "full of art and folklore". "One of the finest films I have seen in a long time. Congratulations Rishab for making wonderful cinema...great cinematography," he said. Earlier, Kangana Ranaut, Ram Gopal Varma and others also praised the film.

294.title: I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people: Jaya Bachchan on media persons
294.article_body: Speaking about media persons, Jaya Bachchan said they sell products by invading people's personal space. "I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people. I always tell them, I say, 'Aapko sharam nahi aati hai?' (Don't you feel ashamed?)," she added. "I despise the people who interfere in your personal life...fill their stomachs by selling those products," Jaya stated.

295.title: Pune will get 7 new police stations: Chandrakant Patil
295.article_body: District Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil said that Pune will get seven new police stations in the city after he conducted a meeting with police officials. Patil also stated that steps will be taken to address shortage of manpower in the city police. The police stations will come up at Wagholi, Kharadi, Phursungi, Baner, Nanded City, Kale Padal and Ambegaon.

296.title: MP bans firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni due to poor air quality
296.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh government has banned firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni districts due to poor Air Quality Index (AQI). The government issued a notice that states green crackers can be burst from 8 pm to 10 pm only in those cities where the air quality is medium or below category. 
A letter has been written to the local district collectors.

297.title: Suresh Raina's 'Arshdeep will dismiss Babar' prediction comes true, fans react
297.article_body: After India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam for a golden duck in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, fans reacted to Suresh Raina's two-day-old prediction coming true. One of the fans wrote, "Einstein of palmistry?" "Very Prophetic. Are you the new Jofra Archer?" wrote another fan.

298.title: Hardik Pandya smiles at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him, pic goes viral
298.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya smiled at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Haider Ali was dismissed on the last ball of the 14th over after being caught in the deep by Suryakumar Yadav. Hardik Pandya registered bowling figures of 4-0-30-3 in the match.

299.title: Amit Shah congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 satellites
299.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) for the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites and called it a landmark day for India's space programme. "India stepped into a new era of self-reliance with the successful launch of its heaviest rocket, LVM3...Congratulations to our scientists and the entire team," said Shah.

300.title: Hyd police, narcotics wing arrest 3 persons, seize 40 gm cocaine
300.article_body: Panjagutta Police and Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing have arrested a Nigerian man and two others for allegedly peddling drugs, Hyderabad City Police said on Saturday. Police added that 40 gm of cocaine and eight phones worth a total of ₹5 lakh were also seized. So far, five people who're purchasing drugs from the accused have been identified, police further said.

301.title: Man hacked to death after wife beats her harassers with sandals in B'luru
301.article_body: After a woman hit her harassers with sandals after being told to do so in Bengaluru, her husband was hacked to death. Preliminary investigations revealed that the husband was killed as revenge. The deceased, a 33-year-old man, was hacked to death while he was standing on the terrace of his house, reports said.

302.title: Gurugram Police arrest 3 men for cheating in Delhi Police Examination
302.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested three people, including the manager of a multinational firm and a scholar, for allegedly cheating in the Delhi Police Examination 2022. The accused have been identified as Tarun Shukla, Jaiveer Kumar and Lalit Yadav. Notably, Shukla helped Kumar enter the test centre illegally in order to write the exam for Yadav, police said.

303.title: 8 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹2 lakh cr to m-cap; RIL top gainer
303.article_body: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of eight of top 10 most valued firms rose by ₹2.03 lakh crore  as Sensex rose 1,466.46 points, or 2.54%, over the last week. Top gainer Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) m-cap rose ₹68,296.41 crore to ₹16.72 lakh crore. RIL was followed by SBI, which added ₹30,120.57 crore, and ICICI Bank, which added ₹25,946.89 crore to its m-cap.

304.title: Rishi Sunak declares he's running to become the UK's next PM
304.article_body: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak on Sunday formally declared that he's running to become the UK's next Prime Minister. "I want to fix our economy, unite our Party and deliver for our country," Sunak tweeted. This comes after Liz Truss resigned as the UK's PM 45 days after taking over the role.

305.title: ICICI Bank reappoints Sandeep Bakhshi as MD, CEO for 3 years
305.article_body: The board of directors of ICICI Bank has re-appointed Sandeep Bakhshi as the managing director (MD) and chief executive officer (CEO) of the bank for the next three years. The current tenure of Bakhshi was until October 3, 2023. Bakhshi's reappointment will be subject to the approval of the RBI and the shareholders of the bank.

306.title: 306 madrassas, including Darul Uloom, declared illegal in UP’s Saharanpur
306.article_body: The Saharanpur administration has declared 306 Islamic educational institutions as illegal, including Deoband's Darul Uloom, after a survey was conducted by the authorities. "An investigation was [conducted] on the basis of parameters set by the administration like the year of establishment of the madrassa, the society that runs it...and their source of income," an officer said.

307.title: Police seize ₹63 lakh hawala money in Hyderabad, 5 arrested
307.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force, in coordination with the Central Zone Police, busted a hawala racket on Sunday in Hyderabad's Troop Bazar and arrested five persons. The police seized cash worth ₹63,50,000 along with a two-wheeler, five mobile phones and a cashier machine. The police caught the accused while raiding an electrical godown at Ranuja Marketing.

308.title: Assam government hikes DA by 4% for employees
308.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Twitter, announced an additional dearness allowance (DA) of 4% for all government employees and all India service officers as a festival gift. He said the additional DA will be effective from July 1, and the additional amount will be paid with October's salary. It will increase the DA of the employees to 35%.

309.title: Representation matters: Priyanka on Diwali holiday in NYC schools
309.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra has reacted to the news of Diwali being announced as a public school holiday in New York City from 2023 onwards. "After all these years! My teenage self living in Queens is crying tears of joy. Representation matters," she wrote on Instagram. On the work front, Priyanka's next Bollywood project is 'Jee Le Zaraa'.

310.title: Adopt stray dogs, take them home if you want to feed them: Bombay HC
310.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur Bench has said, "If any person is interested in feeding stray dogs, he shall first adopt the stray dog/bitch, bring it to home, register it with Municipal Authorities or put it in some dogs shelter." It also directed Nagpur civic body to impose up to ₹200 fine on people feeding stray dogs in public places.

311.title: Mandy Moore welcomes second child with husband Taylor, shares pics
311.article_body: Actress Mandy Moore and her husband Taylor Goldsmith welcomed their second child. On October 22, Moore shared some pictures on Instagram and introduced her newborn baby boy as Oscar Bennett Goldsmith. "Our hearts have doubled in size and the immediacy of the love is astounding. He is beyond words and we're so grateful for our family of four," she wrote.

312.title: New data transmission record set using a single light source
312.article_body: An international group of researchers from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden have set a new data transmission record of 1.8 petabits per second. The record data transmission speed was achieved using only a single laser and an optical chip. Notably, 1 petabit corresponds to 1 million gigabits.

313.title: Student run over by bus at Bangalore University succumbs to injuries
313.article_body: The 23-year-old student, who was run over by a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus at Bangalore University's Jnana Bharati campus, has succumbed to her injuries, 13 days after the accident. She had slipped while boarding the bus and was crushed under its rear wheel on October 10. Following the accident, students blocked the campus' gates and prevented vehicles from entering.

314.title: Plane carrying Gold's Gym owner & family crashes near Costa Rica; all 6 feared dead
314.article_body: A plane carrying businessman Rainer Schaller, who owns fitness and gym outlets like Gold's Gym and McFit, crashed into the Caribbean just off the Costa Rican coast. Piloted by a Swiss national, Schaller was travelling with his partner, Christiane Schikorsky, their two children and a fitness trainer. According to authorities, all six people are feared dead.

315.title: Ferrari hits railing on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; no one hurt
315.article_body: A speeding Ferrari rammed into the railing on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai, police said. The car reportedly belongs to an industrialist. The police added that no one was injured in the incident. "The car was speeding and we suspect it was about to race on the Sea Link but...it veered out of control," a police official said.

316.title: B'luru cab drivers create groups on Telegram to connect with customers
316.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have created multiple groups on Telegram to stay connected with customers amid ongoing discussions between the Karnataka government and app-based cab aggregators like Ola and Uber. Drivers reportedly add customers they meet on a daily basis to the groups. Customers can ask for a cab in the group and the nearest driver interacts with them directly.

317.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out in Andhra Pradesh cracker shops, video surfaces
317.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out at a cluster of cracker shops in Andhra Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the crackers were being unloaded from a van. A video of the burning shops surfaced online. An official statement said that the actual reason behind the fire is being ascertained.

318.title: Rohit Sharma gets emotional during National Anthem ahead of Pakistan match, video viral
318.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma got emotional during the National Anthem ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan in Melbourne. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen trying to fight back tears. The ICC also shared the video on Instagram, writing, "The emotions are real!"

319.title: Arshdeep dismisses Babar Azam for golden duck on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery
319.article_body: Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery. The 23-year-old pacer, who is India's youngest member at T20 World Cup 2022, dismissed Babar LBW with an inswinging delivery. Babar opted for a review but the third umpire confirmed his dismissal.

320.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters T'gana after completing its K'taka leg
320.article_body: Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Telangana on Sunday after completing its Karnataka leg. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was accorded a grand welcome at the Telangana-Karnataka border by Telangana Congress leaders. After entering Gudeballur, the yatra halted for a break on the occasion of Diwali. It will resume from there on the morning of October 27.

321.title: Man sitting inside car dies as gas cylinder fitted in vehicle explodes in TN
321.article_body: A person who was sitting inside a car in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore died after a gas cylinder that was fitted inside the vehicle exploded. The identity of the person is yet to be ascertained. Police said that the process of collecting evidence is on. Security has been tightened in the area following the incident.

322.title: I've switched off TV, doused myself with anti-jinx spray: Mahindra on India-Pak match
322.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra said that he has doused himself with "anti-jinx spray" ahead of India-Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "As always, I am ready for the...match...[I] have my anti-stress ball and worry beads at my side. And my TV set firmly switched off," he tweeted. Mahindra joked that he'll now only wait for news of the result.

323.title: Burn under control now: CEO on report of Unacademy's losses jumping 85% in FY22
323.article_body: Reacting to a report on Unacademy's losses jumping 85% from ₹1,537 crore in FY21 to ₹2,848 crore in FY22 due to high ESOP costs, CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "We spent a lot in FY22 to gain market share. Burn is under control now." Earlier, a report said Unacademy has cut its monthly expenditure to ₹50-60 crore from over ₹200 crore.

324.title: Flying car prototype worth ₹2.5 crore whose sides become wings unveiled in US
324.article_body: American startup Alef Aeronautics has unveiled a flying car prototype costing $300,000 (about ₹2.5 crore). The car features a body that flips on its side to become the wings after lift-off and mesh on its top surface to let air flow through. It can be driven on a regular street and is capable of vertical take off and landing.

325.title: Jennifer Aniston reached out the most: Perry on his substance abuse
325.article_body: Actor Matthew Perry said his 'Friends' co-star Jennifer Aniston had confronted him about his alcohol and drug abuse, and often reached out to him. "She was the one who reached out the most. I'm really grateful to her for that," he said. Perry recalled taking 55 Vicodin a day during 'Friends' and admitted that he "didn't know how to stop".

326.title: Amitabh Bachchan reveals he cut a vein on his left calf, was rushed to hospital
326.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has said that he was recently rushed to a hospital after he cut a vein on his left calf. "A jutting piece of metal sliced my left calf and managed to cut the vein...the vein when cut spurts out the 'red' uncontrollably," he wrote in his blog. He added that he received stitches to control the bleeding.

327.title: Pak have better quality in death overs: Hogg on T20 WC match vs India
327.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pakistan "definitely" have better quality in their bowling department in the death overs in comparison to India, ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides. "When it comes to middle overs, India have better spinners than...Pakistan...They have spinners who can pick up wickets but also nullify the run-rate," added Hogg.

328.title: Congress suspends rape accused Kerala MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly
328.article_body: The Congress in Kerala suspended rape accused MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly for six months. "The explanation provided by him on the allegations was not satisfactory. As a representative of the people, he failed to exercise due diligence," the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee said. A woman had recently filed a rape and attempt to murder case against him.

329.title: Top marketing officer sexually harasses ex-staffer in Mumbai; booked
329.article_body: The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) of a leading financial company was booked for allegedly sexually harassing a former female employee in Mumbai. The woman claimed that the accused had also threatened to fire her when she refused his sexual advances, according to police. The woman was reportedly fired after the HR department gave clean chit to the accused in 2020.

330.title: Video of 4 men offering namaz inside train in UP surfaces, Railway police launches probe
330.article_body: A video of four men offering namaz inside a train stationed near the Khadda railway station in Uttar Pradesh’s Kushinagar has surfaced on social media. The video was shared by former BJP MLA from Kushinagar Deeplal Bharati. Meanwhile, the Railway police said it has launched a probe into the matter though no FIR has been filed.

331.title: 70-yr-old retired police officer dies after fire engulfs house in Lucknow
331.article_body: A 70-year-old retired Inspector General (IG) of Police died while his wife and son were injured when a fire broke out in their house in Lucknow’s Indira Nagar on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out on the first floor of retired IG DC Pandey’s residence, trapping him and his family. A detailed probe is underway into the matter.

332.title: Helicopter narrowly misses vehicles on Ukraine road; video surfaces
332.article_body: Ukraine's Defense Ministry has shared a video which shows a helicopter narrowly missing vehicles on a road in the country, with the caption, "Welcome to Ukraine." A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "Below the radar has a new meaning," while another user tweeted, "Not your typical way to commute to work, but everyone has a job to do."

333.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
333.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne. India have left out Deepak Hooda, Rishabh Pant, Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel from the playing XI. Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh are the three main fast bowlers in India's playing XI.

334.title: All your pain goes away when you take the field against Pak: Sehwag
334.article_body: Sharing his experience while facing Pakistan, ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Virender Sehwag said, "No matter how much pain you're in, it...goes away when you take the field against them." Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides, Sehwag stated, "It's a big ground...Be very sure before sending the ball over the boundary."

335.title: What is India's record against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
335.article_body: India and Pakistan have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning eight times, including one through a bowl out. India have lost two of their last three T20I matches against Pakistan, including a 10-wicket defeat in T20 World Cup 2021. The T20 World Cup 2022 match will be India-Pakistan's first encounter against each other in Australia.

336.title: Minister slaps woman, she touches his feet in Karnataka; video surfaces
336.article_body: A video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman in Chamarajanagar district during a public event to distribute land title deeds is being widely shared online. The woman could be seen touching the minister's feet after he slaps her. The woman, Kempamma, came to the venue and claimed the selection process for beneficiaries was rigged.

337.title: Pune court grants Father Vincent Pereira bail in the POCSO case
337.article_body: A Pune court on Friday granted bail to Father Vincent Pereira, who was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO) for alleged sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy. The FIR stated that Father Pereira sexually abused the minor boy while two other prominent members of the church allegedly did not act against him.

338.title: Which Indians have smashed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
338.article_body: Among Indians, Yuvraj Singh has slammed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket. He slammed nine maximums in eight innings against Pakistan. He is followed by Virat Kohli (seven), Rohit Sharma (six) and Gautam Gambhir (three). Meanwhile, among Pakistanis, Muhammad Rizwan has slammed the most sixes against India in T20I cricket, with six maximums.

339.title: UP woman raped by stepson, husband's colleagues writes to Prez seeking euthanasia
339.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh, allegedly raped by her stepson and gang-raped by her husband's colleagues, has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu seeking euthanasia. She wrote, "I've lost all my hope in justice. Despite the court's order, police haven't arrested any of the accused." The woman got married to a 55-year-old farmer, three years after her divorce.

340.title: My father tore govt job letter, started Cycle Agarbathies with ₹4,000: Ranga Rao's son
340.article_body: N Ranga Rao, the Founder of Cycle Brand Agarbathies, started his incense business by borrowing ₹4,000 in 1948 after pawning his wife's jewellery. Ranga Rao applied for a central government job after failing in trading and dairy farming, his son Mohan Rangarao revealed. However, he tore up the appointment letter and pursued his dream of becoming an entrepreneur, he added.

341.title: Odisha family says pet dog died due to negligence, FIR filed against doctor
341.article_body: An FIR was filed against a veterinary doctor after a family alleged that their pet dog Dugu died due to negligence of the doctor in Odisha. The dog died on October 17. The family kept his body for four days, hoping for postmortem to find exact cause of his death. The dog died after being brought home from the hospital.

342.title: Audience holds 'Vande Mataram' flags at RRR's Japan screening, makers react
342.article_body: 'RRR' makers on Saturday shared a video in which the Japanese audience was seen holding flags with 'Vande Mataram' written over them. The makers tweeted, "Proud moment for us to see the Vande Mataram flag in the hands of the Japanese and their love towards India at the screening of 'RRR'." The film had its Japan premiere on October 21.

343.title: No player might've faced such pressure: Ajay Jadeja on India-Pak T20 WC match
343.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said "no player" might have experienced similar pressure as that set to be experienced by players featuring in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan. "I doubt we will ever witness a larger crowd than this for an India-Pakistan contest," added Ajay. "India are the better side...There is absolutely no doubt," he stated.

344.title: This Pakistani team is very challenging: Rohit ahead of T20 WC 2022 match
344.article_body: Discussing India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "This Pakistani team is...very challenging...They've been playing good cricket." "All the Pakistan teams I've played...from 2007 to 2022, they've been...good teams," added Rohit. Sharing his approach for the match, Rohit stated, "When we enter the ground...I'll be focused on...[putting] the opposition under pressure."

345.title: Pakistan have the best bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
345.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they've just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

346.title: US girl steals $13,500 from grandmother, gives it to classmates
346.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is facing a grand theft charge after she allegedly stole $13,500 from her grandmother's safe and handed out over $10,000 to her classmates in US' Florida. Officials have recovered about $2,500 from the girl's backpack and around $700 from other students at her school. The arrest report does not mention the reason behind the incident.

347.title: Pakistan have the best bowling in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
347.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they have just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

348.title: Plane crashes into building in New Hampshire; 2 on board plane dead
348.article_body: Two people who were on board a small plane died after it crashed into a building in Keene in US' New Hampshire, authorities said. Eight people who were living in an apartment building, connected to the building hit by the plane, were evacuated after a fire broke out. The cause of crash remains under investigation, Keene Mayor George Hansel said.

349.title: PM Modi congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 OneWeb satellites
349.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites. "Congratulations...on the successful launch of our heaviest launch vehicle LVM3 with 36 OneWeb satellites...LVM3 exemplifies Atmanirbharta...and enhances India's competitive edge in global commercial launch service market," he tweeted.

350.title: 4 men tie up & gangrape 32-yr-old nurse at health centre in Chhattisgarh, record act
350.article_body: Four men allegedly tied up and gangraped a 32-year-old nurse who was working alone at a health centre in Chhattisgarh's Manendragarh district. The nurse alleged that the accused recorded the assault and threatened to murder her if she went to the police. Police have arrested three of the accused, including a 17-year-old boy.

351.title: PM constantly sought to create new avenues for jobs for youth: Union Minister
351.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has constantly sought to create new avenues and opportunities for livelihood, income and government jobs for the country’s youth, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Saturday. Furthermore, Singh said that right from the beginning, the Prime Minister has given the highest priority to the issues related to the youth.
