352.title: Balenciaga, Vogue cut ties with Kanye West over his anti-Semitic comments
352.article_body: Fashion house Balenciaga and fashion magazine Vogue have announced that they'll no longer work with Kanye West. The announcement has come weeks after West's anti-Semitic remarks. "Balenciaga has no longer any relationship nor any plans for future projects related to this artist," the brand's parent company said in a statement. West made his modelling debut at Balenciaga's 2023 show.

353.title: 30-yr-old labourer returning to Bihar dies after cough bout at Pune station
353.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who was returning to his home in Bihar died after he suffered a bout of cough at Pune Railway Station. The Government Railway Police have denied that the man died during a stampede at the railway station amid a huge rush of people heading home for Diwali. Police said the man was unwell, according to primary investigations.

354.title: Suryakumar Yadav, Babar Azam rate their own skills out of 100
354.article_body: The ICC has shared videos of Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan captain Babar Azam rating their skills out of 100. Suryakumar rated his power 90, stroke range 93, spin-playing skills 95, pace-playing skills 93 and his fielding 90. Meanwhile, Babar rated his power 70, stroke range 80, spin-playing skills 75, pace-playing skills 90 and his fielding 60.

355.title: Actors of 90s like SRK or Aamir still understand story's importance: Ghai
355.article_body: Director Subhash Ghai said that the actors of 90s, such as Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, "still understand the importance of" a film's story, but today's generation of actors "wants the money to come first". Ghai said, "They are just bothered about their personal branding and fees; they feel they have become big brands."

356.title: 5 charged after US daycare worker scared kids with Halloween mask
356.article_body: After a video surfaced of a daycare worker scaring children while wearing a Halloween mask in US' Mississippi, four people linked to the video are facing child abuse charges while a fifth person is facing two misdemeanour counts, authorities said. The video showed children crying and running from the masked worker. The owner of the daycare isn't facing any charges.

357.title: US VP Kamala Harris hosts Diwali celebrations in Washington, videos surface
357.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris hosted Diwali celebrations at her official residence, the Naval Observatory, on Friday. Some videos that surfaced on social media from the event showed her lighting sparklers along with her husband and Second Gentleman, Doug Emhoff, and wishing each other 'Happy Diwali'. Several prominent Indian Americans were present at the event.

358.title: K'taka Deputy Speaker Anand Mamani passes away at 56, CM pays tribute
358.article_body: The Deputy Speaker of Karnataka, Anand Mamani (56), passed away late Saturday night in the Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru. He was battling ill health for more than a month. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai paid tribute to his party colleague and said, "I pray that God rest his soul in eternal peace and give his family strength to bear this pain."

359.title: Army Chief, his wife visit Army Base Hospital in Delhi
359.article_body: Chief of Army staff General Manoj Pande and his wife Archana Pande visited the Base Hospital, Delhi Cantt on Saturday and interacted with the serving soldiers and their families. He also lauded the efforts of paramedics for ensuring a conducive healthcare ecosystem. He took over as the new Chief of Army Staff from General Manoj Mukund Naravane on April 30.

360.title: 8 drug peddlers transporting 480 kg ganja held: Rachakonda Police
360.article_body: Rachakonda Police tweeted on Saturday that eight inter-state drug peddlers who were transporting 480 kg of ganja were arrested by Hayathnagar police. The accused were transporting ganja, which they would sell for ₹20,000 per kg, from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad and Karnataka, the police said. The accused were detained under the Preventive Detention Act, the police added.

361.title: Rohit Sharma dons mic while practising in nets, ICC shares video
361.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India captain Rohit Sharma practising in the nets while donning a mic. In the video, Rohit can be heard calling Shami "most dangerous" bowler. "You're swinging the ball very late. I can see everything," he was also heard telling a bowler. He was also seen praising Dinesh Karthik for one of his shots.

362.title: Not here to have a nice and easy time or build a 'me too' company: Ola CEO
362.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal at the company's recent launch event said, "We're not here to build a 'me too' company, we're not here to have a nice and easy time." Addressing allegations of a "hostile" work culture at Ola, Aggarwal said, "We are a very ambitious company." Ola has a culture of high quality and high execution, the 37-year-old added.

363.title: Video shows launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 satellites on board
363.article_body: OneWeb has shared a video showing the launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket carrying the startup's 36 broadband satellites on board. The LVM3 rocket lifted off from the Sriharikota spaceport just after midnight, marking its first commercial satellite launch. At 1.42 am on Sunday, the ISRO confirmed that the mission was completed successfully, with all 36 satellites placed into intended orbits.

364.title: 4 die, over 40 injured as bus meets with accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
364.article_body: Four people were killed while about 42 people were injured after a sleeper bus met with an accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway. The sleeper bus was en route to Ajmer from Gorakhpur. "While praying for peace for the soul of the departed, the Chief Minister has expressed condolences to the bereaved families," a tweet from the CM Office read.

365.title: India reports 1,994 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,432
365.article_body: India reported 1,994 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,112 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,432. The data showed that 2,601 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,961.

366.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping secures historic 3rd term in power
366.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third five-year term after he was elected to the Central Committee by the ruling Communist Party on Saturday, making him the nation's most influential leader since founder Mao Zedong. "I wish to thank the whole Party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us," Jinping told journalists on Sunday.

367.title: 27-year-old drug peddler arrested in Hyderabad, 30 gm of MDMA seized
367.article_body: A 27-year-old man, who was allegedly in possession of MDMA, was arrested by the Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) in coordination with the Golconda Police. The police seized 30 grams of MDMA, a phone and ₹3,000 cash from the accused, a native of UP. He purportedly purchased psychotropic drugs from dealers and supplied them to consumers in Mumbai and Hyderabad.

368.title: They wouldn't cast me as lead because I'm fat: Maanvi on being body shamed
368.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo opened up about being body shamed in the film industry and said that people didn't want to cast her as the lead of their projects because she was fat. "They didn't know what category to fit me in," she said. Maanvi added that she's yet to accept herself and believe that she's perfect as she is.

369.title: Potential explosive device found at Toronto airport; 2 detained
369.article_body: Two people have been detained after a potential explosive device was found near the ferry terminal of Billy Bishop Airport in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. Passengers were evacuated from the airport and flight operations were suspended while the police conducted an investigation. Later, the airport tweeted that the police have concluded the investigation and the device has been disarmed.

370.title: Team India should cut down Babar's singles, bowl straight: Brett Lee
370.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said Team India should bowl "nice and straight" to Babar Azam in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "Cut down the singles...That's the best way to trouble him," added Lee. Talking about Rohit Sharma, Lee stated, "[He]...must...stay in as long as he possibly can...The longer he stays in, the more worried Pakistan will become."

371.title: Thousands gather in Germany in solidarity with protesters in Iran
371.article_body: Tens of thousands of people gathered in Germany's capital city Berlin on Saturday in solidarity with protesters in Iran. People were seen carrying signs which criticised Iranian leaders and had taglines like 'Women, Life, Freedom'. Protests have erupted in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini died in the custody of morality police after allegedly being detained over "improper hijab".

372.title: Guardian Minister to review development projects in Pune Zilla Parishad
372.article_body: Pune Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil will be reviewing developmental projects in Pune Zilla Parishad sanctioned by the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. "Many developmental [projects] in Pune ZP were approved in a hurry in the past. As per the new government resolution, we have decided to scrutinise every work approved by the previous government," said Patil.

373.title: Asked to get jewellery from parents' home, Telangana woman kills husband
373.article_body: A woman killed her husband using a brick in Telangana after he asked her to bring jewellery from her parents' home. Reports said that she hit the man with a brick in a fit of rage. The man sustained injury on his head and died on the spot. The woman surrendered before the police after killing her husband.

374.title: Govt cancels FCRA licence of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation: Reports
374.article_body: The Centre has cancelled the FCRA licence of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF), a non-government organisation associated with the Gandhi family, for allegedly violating the foreign funding law, as per officials. The decision was reportedly taken on the basis of investigations carried out by an inter-ministerial committee formed by the Ministry of Home Affairs in July 2020.

375.title: Who won Player of the Match awards in previous India-Pakistan T20 WC matches?
375.article_body: Shaheen Afridi was named Player of the Match in India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2021 match. Mohammad Asif won the award for taking four wickets in the first-ever India-Pakistan T20 World Cup encounter in 2007. Irfan Pathan won it in final of 2007 edition, while Amit Mishra bagged it in 2014. Virat Kohli won the award in 2012 and 2016 editions.

376.title: Sourav Ganguly names his semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022
376.article_body: Former Team India captain Sourav Ganguly has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022. Ganguly stated that India, South Africa, Australia and England will reach the last four stage of the tournament. "India will be one of the favourites to win the tournament," he added.

377.title: Conman Sukesh releases letter, says 'Jacqueline never asked me for anything except love'
377.article_body: Sukesh Chandrashekhar, the main accused in ₹200-crore extortion case, has released a letter through his lawyer mentioning that it's "very unfortunate" that Jacqueline Fernandez has been named an accused in the case. "We were in a relationship and if I have given her and her family gifts, what's their fault...She never asked me for anything except loving her," he wrote.

378.title: BJP MP launches Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council for students
378.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya launched the Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council, comprising school leaders who will be responsible for independently conducting quarterly events. "[It] is a platform to bring school students into public governance & welfare. The Council will work on fields like environment, climate change, civic responsibility, public policy, sports, art and culture," said Surya.

379.title: Who is India's highest run-scorer and highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history?
379.article_body: Rohit Sharma is India's highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup history, with 847 runs in 33 matches. He's followed by Virat Kohli, who has scored 845 runs in 21 T20 World Cup matches. Ravichandran Ashwin is India's highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cups, with 26 scalps. He is followed by Ravindra Jadeja (21), Harbhajan Singh (16) and Irfan Pathan (16).

380.title: My style is more aggressive: Ola CEO after report claims he called staff 'useless'
380.article_body: After a report, while citing employees, called Ola's work culture "hostile" and stated that CEO Bhavish Aggarwal used Punjabi epithets at staff and told them they were "useless", Aggarwal said, "My style is more aggressive than probably the average new-age entrepreneur." He added, "A sports environment is not where you have a nine-to-five (work). Ola is a place for...ambitious...people."

381.title: Drunk man bumps into vehicles in Chandigarh, hits ASI when he goes to help
381.article_body: A man who was reportedly in an inebriated state heckled people and bumped into vehicles in Chandigarh. Fearing that the man would hurt himself, a passerby called the Police Control Room.  When the Assistant Sub Inspector went to help after the PCR call, the drunk man beat him up. A police officer said that the man tore ASI's uniform.

382.title: Print of King Charles' artwork sells for ₹5.3 lakh, nearly 10 times estimate
382.article_body: A print of a painting by UK's King Charles III was sold for £5,737.50 (more than ₹5.3 lakh) at a recent auction, nearly 10 times its original estimate. The signed print is one of 100 and was estimated to sell for about £600. The King painted the original artwork depicting the Balmoral Castle, a royal residence in Scotland, in 2001.

383.title: I think Shami might miss out: Kumble on T20 WC 2022 match vs Pak
383.article_body: Ex-India head coach Anil Kumble said he thinks India will pick Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh as the main pacers in their lineup for their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "I think Mohammad Shami might miss out," added Kumble. Shami picked three wickets while conceding four runs in an over in a warm-up match against Australia.

384.title: It's disgusting: Shweta on trolls against brother Abhishek Bachchan
384.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said that she finds trolling against Abhishek Bachchan "disgusting" and "really upsetting". Shweta said that she finds it unfair that her brother is "constantly compared to something incomparable" like their father Amitabh Bachchan. "You just completely disregard someone's achievements because someone else in his family has done it better...I think it's disgusting," she added.

385.title: Dad or I aren't that rich to pay people to take me in their films: Janhvi
385.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that her father or she are not that rich to offer money to people to cast her in their films. She said that the work she's getting now is based on her merit. "They must've appreciated something about me. Nobody is so large-hearted that they'd launch a star kid and take a monetary loss," she added.

386.title: No 'eventbaazi', provide employment: Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
386.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi launched a Rozgar Mela by handing over appointment letters to over 75,000 people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "No eventbaazi, provide employment." Furthermore, he added, "At least, the 'jumla king' has been forced by Rahul Gandhi to admit that unemployment is the biggest problem the country and the youth face."

387.title: Man tries to cheat in constable exam by hiding accomplice in washroom, held
387.article_body: An aspiring constable, Lalit Yadav, was arrested for allegedly trying to cheat in a recruitment exam by hiding an accomplice, Jaiveer, in the washroom. Jaiveer reportedly also wrote the exam on behalf of Yadav. Police also arrested an official at the exam centre in connection with the case. Police said they have procured CCTV footage from the exam centre.

388.title: Man threatens paan shop owner with air gun in Hyderabad; arrested
388.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly creating a commotion in Hyderabad's Old City after he threatened a paan shop owner with an air gun on Saturday. An argument occurred after the accused bought three cigarettes from the shop and paid ₹10 but when the shop owner demanded that he should pay the remaining amount, he refused, a police official said.

389.title: Boy fails to alight from train in Navi Mumbai, reunited with family
389.article_body: A 10-year-old Nigerian boy was reunited with his family after he failed to alight from a train at Navi Mumbai's Vashi station and then lost his way, a railway police official said on Saturday. The boy is mentally unwell, the official added. "The boy, his mother, sibling and caretaker were travelling on a Harbour Line local," the official further said.

390.title: Pune man helping lady get illegal power connection for stall electrocuted
390.article_body: A 39-year-old man, Pravin Ashok, was electrocuted in Pune's Aundh after coming in contact with a live wire. He was reportedly helping an unknown lady with an illegal electricity connection for her firecracker stall. Ashok was a daily wage worker and was returning home when the incident took place. Locals immediately rushed him to hospital where he was declared dead.

391.title: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz passes away aged 78
391.article_body: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz has passed away at the age of 78. Mateschitz and Thai businessman Chaleo Yoovidhya founded Red Bull in 1984 and launched the Red Bull brand in 1987. Mateschitz owned 49% of the energy drinks brand. The Austrian billionaire bought the Jaguar Formula One team at 2004-end and rebranded it as Red Bull team.

392.title: Google Pixel uses iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook on Twitter, gets trolled
392.article_body: Google was trolled after the official Twitter handle for its flagship Pixel phone used an iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook. Google Pixel sent a tweet using an iPhone to troll Cook for using a hashtag that has previously been used by an NBA franchise. Google deleted the tweet after Twitter users called it out and reposted from web.

393.title: Means a hell lot to me: Dinesh Karthik on Ricky Ponting praising him
393.article_body: Reacting to a video of Ricky Ponting praising him and calling him "one of the best finishers", Dinesh Karthik wrote, "Thanks Ricky for these beautiful words...which mean a hell of a lot to me." He added, "I'm hoping to spend some time in...near future with you." Karthik also expressed his gratitude for Rohit Sharma and Abhishek Nayar in the post.

394.title: Barmy Army tweets 'What's an India vs Pakistan? Never heard of it'; gets trolled
394.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne, Barmy Army tweeted, "What's an India vs Pakistan...Never heard of it." Trolling Barmy Army, a fan wrote, "Is there any stable govt in England? Never heard of it." Another wrote, "Don't worry, it's a cricket thing, you guys wouldn't know." Another tweet read, "How can you forget your own creation?"

395.title: Ex-Chinese Prez wasn't feeling well: State media after he's escorted out of party meet
395.article_body: After former Chinese President Hu Jintao, who was seated next to Xi Jinping, was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party, state media said he "wasn't feeling well". China's official news agency Xinhua said Jintao insisted on attending the session "despite the fact that he has been taking time to recuperate recently."

396.title: He was kind enough to leave 4-yr-old girl alive: HC on reducing life sentence of her rapist
396.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court has reduced the sentence of life imprisonment, awarded to a man convicted of raping a four-year-old girl, to 20-year rigorous imprisonment. "Considering the fact that he was kind enough to leave the prosecutrix alive, this court is of the opinion that the life imprisonment can be reduced," the court said while calling the crime "demonic".

397.title: Have become greedier about the roles I want to do: Sonakshi Sinha
397.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha said she has "become greedier" in terms of the roles she wants to do. "They have to be challenging me in some particular way or something very different from what I've done before," she said, adding that she still goes by her instinct. Sonakshi's upcoming release is 'Double XL', which also stars Huma Qureshi.

398.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 broadband satellites launched from Sriharikota
398.article_body: ISRO's heaviest rocket LVM3 with 36 broadband satellites onboard was launched from Sriharikota. The satellites belonged to OneWeb, a private communications firm, in which India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor and shareholder. It is the first commercial mission of LVM3. Further, it is the first time an Indian rocket has been launched with six-ton payload, as per ISRO.

399.title: Hosting FIFA U-17 women's WC was a learning process: Odisha govt
399.article_body: Odisha Sports Secretary Vineel Krishna said that hosting the FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup was a great learning process. "There are so many things involved in hosting a FIFA event...One has to take care of protocols ranging from security to accreditations," Krishna said. He added, "For the U-17 WC, we had the main stadium and another five training sites."

400.title: TN logs 214 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
400.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 214 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Saturday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 3,316, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Chennai logged 53 new cases, the highest among all districts in the state.

401.title: Pak PM Shehbaz calls predecessor Imran Khan a 'certified thief’
401.article_body: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday called his predecessor Imran Khan a "certified thief" a day after the latter's disqualification over concealment of assets in the Toshakhana case. Pakistan's Election Commission on Friday disqualified Khan from holding public office for five years for failing to declare the money he received from selling state gifts during his tenure as PM.
